column1: recipe

This is called the Brainteaser. 30 ml white of Sambuca, 30 ml of Erin Cream, 5 ml of Advocaat. layered erin first, then sambuca and then avocart(should sit in middle of other two. To drink: use a straw to suck up avocart then shot the rest and then suck fumes up through straw.
This is called the Porto flip. 3 parts of Brandy, 9 parts of Port, 2 parts of Egg Yolk. Shake ingredients together in a mixer with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve.

This is called the Planter's Punch. 1 part of Dark rum, 1/2 part of Orgeat syrup, 2 parts of Orange juice, 1 part of Pineapple juice. Pour all ingredients, except the bitters, into shaker filled with ice. Shake well. Pour into large glass, filled with ice. Add Angostura bitters, "on top". Garnish with cocktail cherry and pineapple.

This is called the Pink Penocha. 750 ml of Everclear, 1750 ml of Vodka, 1750 ml of Peach schnapps, 1 gal of Orange juice, 1 gal of Cranberry juice. mix all ingredients into bowl keep iced stir frequently
This is called the Paradise. 7 parts of Gin, 4 parts of Apricot Brandy, 3 parts of Orange Juice. Shake together over ice. Strain into cocktail glass and serve chilled.

This is called the Blind Russian. 3/4 oz of Bailey's irish cream, 3/4 oz of Godiva liqueur, 3/4 oz of Kahlua, 1/2 oz of Butterscotch schnapps,  to fill Milk. Fill glass with ice. Add all liquers. Add milk. shake.

This is called the Blackthorn. 1 oz of Sweet Vermouth, 1 1/2 oz of Sloe gin, 1 twist of of Lemon peel. Stir sloe gin and vermouth with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

This is called the National Aquarium. 1/2 oz of Rum, 1/2 oz of Vodka, 1/2 oz of Gin, 1/2 oz of Blue Curacao, 2 oz of Sour mix, 1 splash of Lemon-lime soda. Pour all ingredients into a shaker of ice. Shake well. Serve on the rocks.

This is called the Mulled Wine. 3 cups of Water, 1 cup of Sugar, 12 of Cloves, 2 of Cinnamon, 1 of Lemon peel, 750 ml of Red wine, 1/4 cup of Brandy. Simmer 3 cups water with, sugar, cloves, cinnamon sticks, and lemon peel in a stainless steel pot for 10 minutes. Add wine heat to a "coffee temperature" (DO NOT BOIL) then add the brandy.
This is called the Mimosa. Chilled of Champagne, 2 oz of Orange juice. Ensure both ingredients are well chilled, then mix into the glass. Serve cold.

This is called the Quick F**K. 1 part of Kahlua, 1 part of Midori melon liqueur, 1 part of Bailey's irish cream. In a shot glass add 1/3 Kahlua first. Then 1/3 Miduri, topping it off with a 1/3 bailey's irish cream
This is called the Queen Bee. 1 oz of Coffee brandy, 1 1/2 oz of Lime vodka, 1/2 oz cream of Sherry. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
This is called the Poppy Cocktail. 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 3/4 oz white of Creme de Cacao. Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Boomerang. 2 oz of Gin, 1/2 oz of Dry Vermouth, 2 dashes of Bitters, 1/2 tsp of Maraschino liqueur, 1 of Maraschino cherry. In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, vermouth, bitters, and maraschino liqueur. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry.

This is called the Bluebird. 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 1/2 oz of Triple sec, 1/2 oz of Blue Curacao, 2 dashes of Bitters, 1 of Maraschino cherry, 1 twist of of Lemon peel. In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine the gin, triple sec, Curacao, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist and the cherry.
This is called the Pink Lady. 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 1 tsp of Grenadine, 1 tsp of Light cream, 1 of Egg white. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
This is called the Pineapple Gingerale Smoothie. 1/4 inch of Ginger, 1/2 of Pineapple. Throw everything into a blender and liquify.

This is called the Bloody Mary. 1 1/2 oz of Vodka, 3 oz of Tomato juice, 1 dash of Lemon juice, 1/2 tsp of Worcestershire sauce, 2-3 drops of Tabasco sauce, 1 wedge of Lime. Stirring gently, pour all ingredients into highball glass. Garnish.
This is called the Nutty Irishman. 1 part of Bailey's irish cream, 1 part of Frangelico, 1 part of Milk. Serve over ice

This is called the New York Sour. 2 oz of Blended whiskey, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon, 1 tsp of Sugar,  (Claret) Red wine,  Lemon,  Cherry. Shake blended whiskey, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Float claret on top. Decorate with the half-slice of lemon and the cherry and serve.
This is called the Belgian Blue. 2 cl of Vodka, 1 cl of Coconut liqueur, 1 cl of Blue Curacao, Fill with of Sprite. Just pour all ingredients in the glass and stir...

This is called the Barracuda. 4.5 cl of Rum, 1.5 cl of Galliano, 6 cl of Pineapple Juice,  1 dash of Lime Juice, top up of Prosecco. Shake pour ingredients with ice. Strain into glass, top with Sparkling wine.
This is called the Banana Strawberry Shake. 1/2 lb frozen of Strawberries, 1 frozen of Banana, 1 cup plain of Yoghurt, 1 cup of Milk,  to taste Honey. Blend all together in a blender until smooth.
This is called the Bailey's Dream Shake. 2 oz of Bailey's irish cream, 2 scoops of Vanilla ice-cream,  Cream. Blend ingredients for 30 seconds. Definitely refreshing for a hot summer's day !
This is called the Bacardi Cocktail. 1 3/4 oz Bacardi of Light rum, 1 oz of Lime juice, 1/2 tsp of Sugar syrup, 1 dash of Grenadine. Shake together with ice. Strain into glass and serve.
This is called the Monkey Wrench. 1 1/2 oz of Light rum, 3 oz of Grapefruit juice, 1 dash of Bitters. Pour all of the ingredients into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

This is called the Mojito #3. 1/2 handful of Mint, 3 cl of Lemon juice, 1/8 L Jamaican of Dark rum, 1/8 L of Club soda, 8 drops of Angostura bitters. Put mint with lemon juice in a glas, mash the mint with a spoon, ice, rum & fill up with club soda. Top it with Angostura.

This is called the Mississippi Planters Punch. 1 oz of Brandy, 1/2 oz of Light rum, 1/2 oz of Bourbon, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon, 1 tblsp of Powdered sugar,  Carbonated water. Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

This is called the Midnight Manx. 1 oz of Kahlua, 1 oz of Bailey's irish cream, dash of Goldschlager, 2 oz of Heavy cream, 2 oz Hazlenut of Coffee. Fill a mixer with ice and add Baileys, Kahlua, Goldshlager, and cream. Shake for 5 seconds and Strain into a double rocks glass filled with ice. Add chilled coffee Stir and enjoy!

This is called the Arthur Tompkins. 2 oz of Gin, 1/2 oz of Grand Marnier, 2 tsp of Lemon juice, 1 twist of of Lemon peel. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, Grand Marnier, and lemon juice. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
This is called the Black Russian. 3/4 oz of Coffee liqueur, 1 1/2 oz of Vodka. Pour the ingredients into an old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.
This is called the Orange Whip. 4 oz of Orange juice, 1 oz of Rum, 1 oz of Vodka, 1 package of Cream, Over of Ice. Pour ingredients over ice and stir.

This is called the Black & Tan. 1 part Bass pale of Ale, 1 part of Guinness stout. Fill pint glass half full with Bass. Next pour Guiness over a spoon slowly until glass is full. If done correctly the Guiness will stay on top and the Bass on bottom hence the name Black & Tan.
This is called the Bible Belt. 2 oz of Southern Comfort, 1/2 oz of Triple sec, 2 wedges of Lime, 2 oz of Sour mix. Mix all ingredients, and pour over ice.

This is called the Old Fashioned. 4.5 cL of Bourbon, 2 dashes of Angostura bitters, 1 cube of Sugar, dash of Water. Place sugar cube in old fashioned glass and saturate with bitters, add a dash of plain water. Muddle until dissolved.
Fill the glass with ice cubes and add whiskey.

Garnish with orange twist, and a cocktail cherry.
This is called the Banana Strawberry Shake Daiquiri-type. 1/2 lb frozen of Strawberries, 1 frozen of Banana, 2 cups fresh of Apple juice. Blend all together in a blender until smooth.

This is called the Baby Eskimo. 2 oz of Kahlua, 8 oz of Milk, 2 scoops of Vanilla ice-cream. Leave ice-cream out for about 10 minutes. Add ingredients in order, stir with chopstick (butter knife or spoon works too). Consume immediately and often. Nice and light, great for following a heavy drink.

This is called the Miami Vice. 5 oz Bacardi of 151 proof rum, frozen of Pina colada mix, frozen of Daiquiri mix. First: Mix pina colada with 2.5 oz. of rum with ice(set aside). Second: Mix daiquiri with 2.5 oz. of rum with ice. Third: While frozen, add pina colda mix then daiquiri mix in glass (Making sure they do not get mixed together).

This is called the Atomic Lokade. 5 oz of Lemonade, 1 oz of Vodka, 1/2 oz of Blue Curacao, 1/2 oz of Triple sec,  Sugar,  of Ice. In a shaker, place lemonade, vodka, blue Curacao, and triple sec together. Shake with ice and strain into glass. Add sugar to taste

This is called the Melya.  Espresso, Unsweetened of Honey,  of Cocoa powder. Brew espresso. In a coffee mug, place 1 teaspoon of unsweetened powdered cocoa, then cover a teaspoon with honey and drizzle it into the cup. Stir while the coffee brews, this is the fun part. The cocoa seems to coat the honey without mixing, so you get a dusty, sticky mass that looks as though it will never mix. Then all at once, presto! It looks like dark chocolate sauce. Pour hot espresso over the honey, stirring to dissolve. Serve with cream.

This is called the Frozen Mint Daiquiri. 2 oz of Light rum, 1 tblsp of Lime juice, 6 of Mint, 1 tsp of Sugar. Combine all ingredients with 1 cup of crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and serve.
This is called the Rum Runner. 1 1/2 oz of Malibu rum, 1 oz of Blackberry brandy, 3-4 oz of Orange juice, 3-4 oz of Pineapple juice, 3-4 oz of Cranberry juice. Mix all ingredients in glass & add ice.
This is called the Rum Screwdriver. 1 1/2 oz of Light rum, 5 oz of Orange juice. Pour rum into a highball glass over ice cubes. Add orange juice, stir, and serve.

This is called the Champagne Cocktail. Chilled of Champagne, 1 piece of Sugar, 2 dashes of Bitters, 1 twist of of Lemon peel, 1 dash of Cognac. Add dash of Angostura bitter onto sugar cube and drop it into champagne flute. Add cognac followed by gently pouring chilled champagne. Garnish with orange slice and maraschino cherry.

This is called the Casino Royale. 2 oz of Gin, 1/2 oz of Lemon juice, 1 tsp of Maraschino liqueur, 1 dash of Orange bitters, 1 of Egg yolk. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.

This is called the California Lemonade. 2 oz of Blended whiskey, Juice of 1 of Lemon, Juice of 1 of Lime, 1 tblsp of Powdered sugar, 1/4 tsp of Grenadine,  Carbonated water. Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a collins glass over shaved ice. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Decorate with slices of orange and lemon. Add the cherry and serve with a straw.
This is called the California Root Beer. 3/4 oz of Kahlua, 3/4 oz of Galliano, Fill with of Soda water. Put Kahlua and Galliano in highball glass fill with soda

This is called the Butter Baby. 2 scoops of Vanilla Ice-Cream, 1 part of Butterscotch schnapps, full glass of Milk, 2 parts of Vodka. Blend together in a blender. Serve in a chilled Beer mug with Fresh Blueberries and caramel for topping.

This is called the Bumble Bee #1. 1/3 oz of Bailey's irish cream, 1/3 oz of Kahlua, 1/3 oz of Sambuca. This is a layered shot. First pour the Bailey's into the shot glass. Then take an upside down spoon and touch it to the inside wall of the glass. Carefully add the Kahlua. Repeat this process for the Sambuca. If done properly, the alcohol will stay separated and resemble a bumble bee. Enjoy!!!

This is called the Royal Fizz. 1 oz of Gin, 2 oz of Sweet and sour, 1 whole of Egg,  Coca-Cola. Shake all ingredients (except cola) with ice and strain into a chilled collins glass. Fill with cola and serve.
This is called the Rail Splitter. 2 tsp of Sugar syrup,  Lemon juice,  of Ginger ale. Mix sugar syrup with lemon juice in a tall glass. Fill up with ginger ale.

This is called the Rum Cobbler. 1 tsp superfine of Sugar, 3 oz of Club soda, 1 of Lemon, 2 oz of Dark rum, 1 of Maraschino cherry, 1 of Orange. In an old-fashioned glass, dissolve the sugar in the club soda. Add crushed ice until the glass is almost full. Add the rum. Stir well. Garnish with the cherry and the orange and lemon slices.

This is called the Brandy Sour. 2 oz of Brandy, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon, 1/2 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1/2 slice of Lemon, 1 of Cherry. Shake brandy, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with the lemon slice, top with the cherry, and serve.
This is called the Queen Elizabeth. 1/2 oz of Dry Vermouth, 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 1 1/2 tsp of Benedictine. Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Brain Fart. 1 fifth of Everclear, 1 fifth Smirnoff red label of Vodka, 2 L of Mountain Dew, 2 L of Surge, 1 small bottle of Lemon juice, 1 pint of Rum. Mix all ingredients together. Slowly and gently. Works best if ice is added to punch bowl and soda's are very cold.

This is called the Boxcar. 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 1 oz of Triple sec, 1 tsp of Lemon juice, 1/2 tsp of Grenadine, 1 of Egg white. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.

This is called the Bourbon Sour. 2 oz of Bourbon, 1 oz of Lemon juice, 1/2 tsp superfine of Sugar, 1 of Orange, 1 of Maraschino cherry. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a whiskey sour glass, garnish with the orange slice and cherry.
This is called the Boston Sidecar. 3/4 oz of Light rum, 3/4 oz of Brandy, 3/4 oz of Triple sec, Juice of 1/2 of Lime. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Port Wine Flip. 1 1/2 oz of Port, 2 tsp of Light cream, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1 whole of Egg,  Nutmeg. Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

This is called the Boozy Snickers Milkshake. 3 cups of Vanilla Ice-Cream, 1 cup of Milk, 1/2 cup of Godiva liqueur, for topping of Whipped Cream, 4 tablespoons caramel sauce, 4 tablespoons chocolate sauce, 15 of Mini-snickers bars. Place the snickers bars in a plastic bag and roll over them with a rolling pin until crushed. Add crushed snickers pieces, ice cream, milk, caramel sauce, chocolate sauce, and chocolate liquor to a blender. Blend until shake is thick and frothy. Pour into glasses and top with chocolate liquor and whip cream.

This is called the Orange Push-up. 1.5 oz of Spiced rum, 0.5 oz of Grenadine, 4 oz of Orange juice, 1 splash of Sour mix. Combine liquors in a blender. Add a half scoop of ice and blend. Garnish with an orange and cherry flag. So good it will melt in your mouth!!!
This is called the Absolut Evergreen. 2/3 part of Absolut Citron, 1/3 part of Pisang Ambon,  cubes Ice,  Bitter lemon. Mix, pour over ice and top up with Bitter Lemon.

This is called the Absinthe #2. 1 bottle of Vodka, 50 gr of Sugar, 50 ml pure of Anise, 1 tblsp of Licorice root, 1 of Wormwood. Mix together and let sit a few days. Strain through a coffee filter. To serve mix 1 part absinthe to 4 parts water, add ice, enjoy.
This is called the Grizzly Bear. 1 part of Amaretto, 1 part of Jägermeister, 1 part of Kahlua, 2 1/2 parts of Milk. Served over ice. Sounds nasty, but tastes great.
This is called the Godmother. 1 1/2 oz of Vodka, 3/4 oz of Amaretto. Pour vodka and amaretto into an old-fashioned glass over ice and serve.

This is called the A1. 1 3/4 shot of Gin, 1 Shot of Grand Marnier, 1/4 Shot of Lemon Juice, 1/8 Shot of Grenadine. Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, mix and serve over ice into a chilled glass.
This is called the Godfather. 1 1/2 oz of Scotch, 3/4 oz of Amaretto. Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.
This is called the A. J.. 1 1/2 oz of Applejack, 1 oz of Grapefruit juice. Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Gin Squirt. 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 1 tsp of Grenadine, 1 tblsp of Powdered sugar, 3 chunks of Pineapple, 2 of Strawberries,  Carbonated water. Stir gin, grenadine, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Decorate with the pineapple chunks and the strawberries and serve.

This is called the Tia-Maria. 1 cup of Water, 3/4-1 cup of Brown sugar, 4 tsp of Coffee, 1 cup of Rum, 4 tsp of Vanilla extract. Boil water, sugar and coffe for 10 mins and let cool. Add rum and vanilla. Put in clean bottle(s) and leave for 1 week before using.

This is called the Thai Iced Coffee. black of Coffee,  Sugar,  pods Cream,  Cardamom. Prepare a pot of coffee at a good European strength. In the ground coffee, add 2 or 3 freshly ground cardamom pods. Sweeten while hot, then cool quickly. Serve in highball glass over ice, with cream. To get the layered effect, place a spoon atop the coffee and pour the milk carefully into the spoon so that it floats on the top of the coffee.
This is called the Foxy Lady. 1/2 oz of Amaretto, 1/2 oz of Creme de Cacao, 2 oz of Light cream. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Egg-Nog - Classic Cooked. 6 of Egg, 1/4 cup of Sugar, 1/4 tsp of Salt, 1 qt of Milk, 1 tsp of Vanilla extract. In large saucepan, beat together eggs, sugar and salt, if desired. Stir in 2 cups of the milk. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick enough to coat a metal spoon and reaches 160 degrees F. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 2 cups milk and vanilla. Cover and regfigerate until thoroughly chilled, several hours or overnight. Just before serving, pour into bowl or pitcher. Garnish or add stir-ins, if desired. Choose 1 or several of: Chocolate curls, cinnamon sticks, extracts of flavorings, flavored brandy or liqueur, fruit juice or nectar, ground nutmeg, maraschino cherries, orange slices, peppermint sticks or candy canes, plain brandy, run or whiskey, sherbet or ice-cream, whipping cream, whipped. Serve immediately.

This is called the Sweet Sangria. 2 bottles of Red wine, 1 cup of Sugar, 2 cups hot of Water, 1 cup of Apple,  wedges Orange,  wedges Lime,  Lemon,  Fresca. Dissolve the sugar in hot water and cool. Peel the citrus fruits and break into wedges. Mix the wine, sugar syrup, fruit, and Fresca in a pitcher and put in the fridge for a few hours. Serve in tall glasses with a straw.

This is called the Egg Nog - Healthy. 1/2 cup of Egg, 3 tblsp of Sugar, 13 oz skimmed of Condensed milk, 3/4 cup skimmed of Milk, 1 tsp of Vanilla extract, 1 tsp of Rum,  Nutmeg. Whip egg substitute and sugar together, combine with the two kinds of milk, vanilla, and rum. Mix well. Chill over night. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Makes 6 servings.

This is called the Swedish Coffee. 1 cup of Coffee, 4 cl of Aquavit, By taste of Sugar. Pour the coffee in an ordinary coffee cup. Add the aquavit. Add sugar by taste. Stir and have a nice evening (morning)
This is called the Egg Cream. 2 tblsp of Chocolate syrup, 6 oz whole of Milk, 6 oz of Soda water. Mix syrup and milk in a fountain glass. Add soda water, serve with a straw.

This is called the Strawberry Shivers. 1 1/2 cup of Strawberries, 4 tsp of Honey, 1/2 cup of Water. Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

This is called the Dry Rob Roy. 2 1/2 oz of Scotch, 1 1/2 tsp of Dry Vermouth, 1 twist of of Lemon peel. In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.
This is called the White Russian. 2 oz of Vodka, 1 oz of Coffee liqueur,  Light cream. Pour vodka and coffee liqueur over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass. Fill with light cream and serve.

This is called the Vesuvio. 1 oz of Light rum, 1/2 oz of Sweet Vermouth, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1 of Egg white. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

This is called the Vampiro. 6 cl of Tequila, 3 cl of Tomato Juice, 3 cl of Orange Juice, 1.5 cl of Lime Juice, 1 dash of Sugar Syrup, 1 pinch of Salt. Vampiros may be made in a tall glass or an old fashioned glass. Bartenders may first "rim" the glass with Kosher Salt, which is done by placing a layer of Kosher Salt on a chopping board, moistening the glass' rim with lime juice or water, and then placing the upside down glass rim onto the Kosher Salt, so that the salt sticks to the moistened rim. The second step is to fill half the glass with ice and add one or two shooter glasses full of high quality Tequila. The next stage is to add the flavouring elements. This is done by squeezing a fresh lime into the glass, adding a few grains of salt, adding citrus-flavoured soda pop, until the glass is 4/5 full, and then adding spicy Viuda de Sanchez (or orange juice, lime juice and pico de gallo). The final step is to stir the ingredients so that the flavours are properly blended.

This is called the The Evil Blue Thing. 1 1/2 oz of Creme de Cacao, 1 oz of Blue Curacao, 1/2 oz of Light rum. Pour ingredients into glass, and drop in a blue whale! The blue whale isn't really necessary, but it makes the drink more "fun".

This is called the French 75. 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 2 tsp superfine of Sugar, 1 1/2 oz of Lemon juice, 4 oz Chilled of Champagne, 1 of Orange, 1 of Maraschino cherry. Combine gin, sugar, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled champagne glass. Top up with Champagne. Stir gently.
This is called the Flying Dutchman. 2 oz of Gin, 1/2 oz of Triple sec. In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and triple sec. Stir well.

This is called the Texas Sling. 1/2 oz of Kahlua, 1/2 oz of Irish cream, 1/2 oz of Amaretto, 1/2 oz Bacardi of 151 proof rum, 1 oz of Cream. Blend with Ice until smooth. Serve in a tulip glass, top with whip cream.
This is called the Flander's Flake-Out. 1/4 glass of Sambuca, 3/4 glass of Sarsaparilla. Bang 'em both in.

This is called the Tequila Sour. 2 oz of Tequila, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1/2 slice of Lemon, 1 of Cherry. Shake tequila, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the half-slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.

This is called the English Rose Cocktail. 3/4 oz of Apricot brandy, 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 3/4 oz of Dry Vermouth, 1 tsp of Grenadine, 1/4 tsp of Lemon juice, 1 of Cherry. Rub rim of cocktail glass with lemon juice and dip rim of glass in powdered sugar. Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into sugar-rimmed glass. Top with the cherry and serve.

This is called the English Highball. 3/4 oz of Brandy, 3/4 oz of Gin, 3/4 oz of Sweet Vermouth,  Carbonated water,  Lemon peel. Pour brandy, gin, and sweet vermouth into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water. Add the twist of lemon peel, stir, and serve. (Ginger ale may be substituted for carbonated water, if preferred.)
This is called the Strawberry Lemonade. Juice of 1 of Lemon, 1 tblsp of Sugar, 8-10 ripe of Strawberries, 1 cup of Water. Throw everything into a blender and mix until fairly smooth. Serve over ice.

This is called the Drinking Chocolate. 2 oz of Heavy cream, 6-8 oz of Milk, 1 stick of Cinnamon, 1 of Vanilla, 2 oz finely chopped dark of Chocolate, Fresh of Whipped cream. Heat the cream and milk with the cinnamon and vanilla bean very slowly for 15-20 minutes. (If you don't have any beans add 1-2 tsp of vanilla after heating). Remove the bean and cinnamon. Add the chocolate. Mix until fully melted. Serve topped with some very dense fresh whipped cream. Serves 1-2 depending upon how much of a glutton you are. For a richer chocolate, use 4 oz of milk, 4 oz of cream, 4 oz of chocolate. Serve in coffee mug.

This is called the Spanish chocolate. 2 cups of Milk, 2 oz sweet of Chocolate, 1/2 tsp of Cinnamon, 2 beaten of Egg yolk. Stir the milk with the chocolate and the cinnamon over low heat until the chocolate dissolves. Add the eggs and beat the mixture until it becomes thick, taking care not to boil. Serve in coffee mug.

This is called the Darkwood Sling. 1 part of Cherry Heering, 1 part of Soda water, 1 part of Orange juice,  cubes Ice. There are many good cherry liqueurs you can use, but I prefere Heering. Add one share of the liqueur. Then you add one share of Soda. For a sour sling use Tonic (most people prefer the drink without Tonic). Afterwards you fill the glass with Orange Juice and ice cubes.

This is called the Dark Caipirinha. 2 tsp of demerara Sugar, 1 of Lime, 2 1/2 oz of Cachaca. Muddle the sugar into the lime wedges in an old-fashioned glass.
Fill the glass with ice cubes.
Pour the cachaca into the glass.
Stir well.

This is called the Singapore Sling. 1/2 oz of Cherry brandy, 1/2 oz of Grenadine, 1 oz of Gin, 2 oz of Sweet and sour, None of Carbonated water, None of Cherry. Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into highball glass. Garnish with pineapple and cocktail cherry.
This is called the Sidecar. 2 oz of Cognac, 1/2 oz of Cointreau, 1 oz of Lemon juice. Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass.

This is called the Coffee Liqueur. 10 tblsp instant of Coffee, 4 tblsp of Vanilla extract, 2 1/2 cups of Sugar, 1 qt of Vodka, 2 1/2 cups of Water. Combine coffee, sugar and water. Simmer 1 hour and let cool. Add vanilla and vodka. Age in sealed jar 2 to 3 weeks.

This is called the City Slicker. 2 oz of Brandy, 1/2 oz of Triple sec, 1 tblsp of Lemon juice. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
This is called the Ziemes Martini Apfelsaft. 4 cl of Vermouth, 16 cl of Apple juice. Serve without ice. At least the juice shold have room temperature.
This is called the Waikiki Beachcomber. 3/4 oz of Triple sec, 3/4 oz of Gin, 1 tblsp of Pineapple juice. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
This is called the Wine Punch. 1 bottle of Red wine, 2 of Lemon, 1 cup of Orange juice, 3 of Orange, 1 cup of Pineapple juice. Combine all of the ingredients and pour over a block of ice.
This is called the Vodka Russian. 2 oz of Vodka,  Schweppes Russchian. Mix it as a ordinary drink .

This is called the Vodka Martini. 1 1/2 oz of Vodka, 3/4 oz of Dry Vermouth, 1 of Olive. Shake the vodka and vermouth together with a number of ice cubes, strain into a cocktail glass, add the olive and serve.

This is called the Vermouth Cassis. 1 1/2 oz of Dry Vermouth, 3/4 oz of Creme de Cassis,  Carbonated water. Stir vermouth and creme de cassis in a highball glass with ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir again, and serve.
This is called the Victor. 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 1/2 oz of Sweet Vermouth, 1/2 oz of Brandy. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Turf Cocktail. 1 oz of Dry Vermouth, 1 oz of Gin, 1/4 tsp of Anis, 2 dashes of Bitters, Twist of of Orange peel. Stir all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.

This is called the Tuxedo Cocktail. 1 1/2 oz of Dry Vermouth, 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 1/4 tsp of Maraschino liqueur, 1/4 tsp of Anis, 2 dashes of Orange bitters, 1 of Cherry. Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry and a twist of lemon zest.

This is called the Thriller. 1 1/2 oz of Scotch, 1 oz Green Ginger of Wine, 1 oz of Orange juice. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
This is called the Cherry Rum. 1 1/4 oz of Light rum, 1 1/2 tsp of Cherry brandy, 1 tblsp of Light cream. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Casino. 2 oz of Gin, 1/4 tsp of Maraschino liqueur, 1/4 tsp of Lemon juice, 2 dashes of Orange bitters, 1 of Cherry. Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist and a maraschino cherry. Serve without a straw.

This is called the Rum Old-fashioned. 1 1/2 oz of Light rum, 1 tsp of 151 proof rum, 1/2 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1 dash of Bitters, 1 tsp of Water, Twist of of Lime peel. Stir powdered sugar, water, and bitters in an old-fashioned glass. When sugar has dissolved add ice cubes and light rum. Add the twist of lime peel, float 151 proof rum on top, and serve.

This is called the Rum Cooler. 2 oz light or dark of Rum, 4 oz of Lemon-lime soda, 1 of Lemon. Pour the rum and soda into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the lemon wedge.
This is called the Bubble Gum. 1/4 of Vodka, 1/4 of Banana liqueur, 1/4 of Orange juice, 1/4 of Peach schnapps. Layer in order into a shot glass.

This is called the Bruised Heart. 1/2 oz of Vodka, 1/2 oz of Chambord raspberry liqueur, 1/2 oz of Peachtree schnapps, 1/2 oz of Cranberry juice. Pour all ingredients in a mixing tin over ice, stir, and strain into shot glass

This is called the Brandy Cobbler. 1 tsp superfine of Sugar, 3 oz of Club soda, 1 of Lemon, 2 oz of Brandy, 1 of Maraschino cherry, 1 of Orange. In an old-fashioned glass, dissolve the sugar in the club soda. Add crushed ice until the glass is almost full. Add the brandy. Stir well. Garnish with the cherry and the orange and lemon slices.
This is called the Queen Charlotte. 2 oz of Red wine, 1 oz of Grenadine,  Lemon-lime soda. Pour red wine and grenadine into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with lemon-lime soda, stir, and serve.
This is called the Quaker's Cocktail. 3/4 oz of Light rum, 3/4 oz of Brandy, Juice of 1/4 of Lemon, 2 tsp of Raspberry syrup. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
This is called the Zimadori Zinger. 1.5 oz of Midori melon liqueur, 12 oz of Zima. Pour Zima in a collins glass over ice and then pour the shot of Midori. Don't stir. Garnish with a cherry.
This is called the Zenmeister. 1/2 oz of Jägermeister, 1/2 oz of Root beer. Mix together and enjoy
This is called the Whisky Mac. 1 1/2 oz of Scotch, 1 oz Green Ginger of Wine. Pour both of the ingredients into a wine goblet with no ice.

This is called the Victory Collins. 1 1/2 oz of Vodka, 3 oz of Lemon juice, 3 oz unsweetened of Grape juice, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1 slice of Orange. Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of orange and serve.
This is called the Veteran. 2 oz of Dark rum, 1/2 oz of Cherry brandy. Pour the rum and cherry brandy into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
This is called the Tommy's Margarita. 4.5 cl of Tequila, 1.5 cl of Lime Juice, 2 spoons of Agave syrup. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

This is called the Zoksel.  Beer,  Root beer,  Lemonade,  slice Coca-Cola,  7-Up,  Creme de Cassis,  Lemon. No specific mixinginstructions, just poor every ingredient in one glass. The lemon goes with it.

This is called the Zippy's Revenge. 2 oz of Amaretto, 2 oz of Rum, 4 oz Grape of Kool-Aid. Mix Kool-Aid to taste then add Rum and ammaretto. shake well to disolve the sugar in the Kool-Aid... serve cold

This is called the Fahrenheit 5000. 1/2 oz of Firewater, 1/2 oz of Absolut Peppar, 1 dash of Tabasco sauce. Cover bottom of shot glass with Tabasco Sauce and then fill with half Firewater and half Absolut Peppar.

This is called the Egg Nog #4. 6 of Egg yolk, 1/4 cup of Sugar, 2 cups of Milk, 1/2 cup of Light rum, 1/2 cup of Bourbon, 1 tsp of Vanilla extract, 1/4 tsp of Salt, 1 cup of Whipping cream, 6 of Egg white. In a small mixer bowl beat egg yolks till blended. Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar, beating at high speed till thick and lemon colored. Stir in milk, stir in rum, bourbon, vanilla, and salt. Chill thoroughly. Whip cream. Wash beaters well. In a large mixer bowl beat egg whites till soft peaks form. Gradually add remaining 1/4 cup sugar, beating to stiff peaks. Fold yolk mixture and whipped cream into egg whites. Serve immediately. Sprinkle nutmeg over each serving. Serve in a punch bowl or another big bowl. NOTE: For a nonalcoholic eggnog, prepare Eggnog as above, except omit the bourbon and rum and increase the milk to 3 cups.

This is called the Duchamp's Punch. 5 cl of Pisco, 2.5 cl of Lime Juice, 2.5 cl of Pineapple Syrup, 1.5 cl of St. Germain, 2 Dashes of Angostura Bitters, Pinch of Pepper, 2 sprigs of Lavender. Shake all ingredients.
Double strain in a chilled double old fashioned glass with abig ice cube.
Garnish with a couple of lavender sprigs

This is called the Dirty Martini. 70ml/2fl oz of Vodka, 1 tbsp of Dry Vermouth, 2 tbsp of Olive Brine, 1 wedge of Lemon, 1 of Olive. Pour the vodka, dry vermouth and olive brine into a cocktail shaker with a handful of ice and shake well.
Rub the rim of a martini glass with the wedge of lemon.
Strain the contents of the cocktail shaker into the glass and add the olive.
A dirty Martini contains a splash of olive brine or olive juice and is typically garnished with an olive.

This is called the Sol Y Sombra. 1 1/2 oz of Brandy, 1 1/2 oz of Anisette. Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a brandy snifter, and serve. (The English translation of the name of this drink is "Sun and Shade", and after sampling this drink, you'll understand why. Thanks, Kirby.)
This is called the Danbooka. 3 parts of Coffee, 1 part of Everclear. pour it in and mix it.

This is called the Creme de Menthe. 8 cups of Sugar, 6 cups of Water, 1 pint of Grain alcohol, 1 oz pure of Peppermint extract, 1 tblsp green of Food coloring. Bring sugar and water to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Cool. Add the remaining ingredients and stir. Cover and let ripen for 1 month.

This is called the Cosmopolitan Martini. 1/2 oz of Cointreau, 1 oz of Vodka, Juice of 1/2 of Lime, 1 splash of Cranberry juice. Pour all ingredients in mixing glass half filled with ice, shake and strain into chilled Martini glass.
This is called the Sea breeze. 1 1/2 oz of Vodka, 4 oz of Cranberry juice, 1 oz of Grapefruit juice. Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.
This is called the Screwdriver. 2 oz of Vodka, None of Orange juice. Mix in a highball glass with ice. Garnish and serve.

This is called the Chicago Fizz. 1 oz of Light rum, 1 oz of Port, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1 of Egg white,  Carbonated water. Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

This is called the Rusty Nail. 1 1/2 oz of Scotch, 1/2 oz of Drambuie, 1 twist of of Lemon peel. Pour the Scotch and Drambuie into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lemon twist.

This is called the Rum Punch. mikey bottle of Rum, large bottle of Ginger ale, 355 ml frozen of Fruit punch, 355 ml frozen of Orange juice, crushed of Ice. Mix all ingredients in a punch bowl and serve.

This is called the Rum Milk Punch. 2 oz of Light rum, 1 cup of Milk, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar,  Nutmeg. Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

This is called the Caipirinha. 2 tsp of Sugar, 1 of Lime, 2 1/2 oz of Cachaca. Place lime and sugar into old fashioned glass and muddle (mash the two ingredients together using a muddler or a wooden spoon). Fill the glass with ice and add the Cachaça.

This is called the Royal Flush. 1 1/2 oz of Crown Royal, 1 oz of Peach schnapps, 1/2 oz of Chambord raspberry liqueur, 1 oz of Cranberry juice. Pour all the ingredients into tumbler over ice. Strain into glass.
This is called the Brave Bull Shooter. 1/2 oz of Tequila, 1/2 oz of Tabasco sauce. Pour Tabasco into bottom of shot glass and fill with tequila.

This is called the Brandy Flip. 2 oz of Brandy, 1 whole of Egg, 1 tsp superfine of Sugar, 1/2 oz of Light cream, 1/8 tsp grated of Nutmeg. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the brandy, egg, sugar, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the nutmeg.

This is called the Sangria #1. 1 bottle of Red wine, 1/2 cup of Sugar, 1 cup of Orange juice, 1 cup of Lemon juice,  Cloves,  of Cinnamon. Mix all together in a pitcher and refrigerate. Add cloves and cinnamon sticks to taste. Serve in wine glasses.
This is called the Zorbatini. 1 1/4 oz Stoli of Vodka, 1/4 oz of Ouzo. Prepare like a Martini. Garnish with a green olive.

This is called the Zipperhead. 1 shot of Chambord raspberry liqueur, 1 shot of Vodka, Fill with of Soda water. Fill glass with rocks, add straw before putting in liquor. Then add the ingredients in order, trying to keep layered as much as possible (i.e. Chambord on bottom, then Vodka, Then soda on top).
This is called the Wine Cooler. 2 oz white or of Red wine, 5 oz of Lemon-lime soda,  cubes Ice. Mix wine and soft drink. Pour into glass. Add ice.

This is called the Whitecap Margarita. 1 cup of Ice, 2 oz of Tequila, 1/4 cup of Cream of coconut, 3 tblsp fresh of Lime juice. Place all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. This makes one drink.
This is called the Vodka And Tonic. 2 oz of Vodka,  Tonic water. Pour vodka into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with tonic water, stir, and serve.
This is called the Vodka Fizz. 2 oz of Vodka, 2 oz of Half-and-half, 2 oz of Limeade,  Ice,  Nutmeg. Blend all ingredients, save nutmeg. Pour into large white wine glass and sprinkle nutmeg on top.
This is called the Valencia Cocktail. 1 1/2 oz of Apricot brandy, 1 tblsp of Orange juice, 2 dashes of Orange bitters. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
This is called the Turkeyball. 1 oz of Wild Turkey, 3/4 oz of Amaretto, 1 splash of Pineapple juice. Shake with ice and strain into a shot glass.

This is called the Spiking coffee.  Coffee,  of Cinnamon. Incidentally, a pinch of cinnamon is indeed a nice addition to coffee but true heaven is a cardamom seed. Of course, you serve it in a coffee mug.
This is called the Dirty Nipple.  Kahlua,  Sambuca,  Bailey's irish cream. This is a layered shot - the Bailey's must be on top
This is called the Daiquiri. 1 1/2 oz of Light rum, Juice of 1/2 of Lime, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar. Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail glass.

This is called the Cuba Libra. 1-2 shot of Dark rum, Squeeze of Lime, Fill with of Coca-Cola,  Ice. Fill tall glass with ice cubes. Add rum. Rub cut edge of lime on rim of glass then squeeze juice into glass. Fill with Coca-Cola. Garnish with lime slice. Enjoy!
This is called the Cream Soda. 1 oz of Spiced rum,  Ginger ale. Pour 1oz of Spiced Rum into a highball glass with ice. Fill with Ginger Ale.
This is called the Shot-gun. 1 part of Jim Beam, 1 part of Jack Daniels, 1 oz of Wild Turkey. Pour one part Jack Daneils and one part Jim Beam into shot glass then float Wild Turkey on top.

This is called the Cranberry Cordial. 1/2 kg chopped of Cranberries, 3/4 L of Sugar, 1/2 L of Light rum. Place the chopped cranberries in a 2 liter jar that has a tight-fitting lid. Add the sugar and rum. Adjust the lid securely and place the jar in a cool, dark place. Invert the jar and shake it every day for six weeks. Strain the cordial into bottles and seal with corks.
This is called the Scooter. 1 oz of Brandy, 1 oz of Amaretto, 1 oz of Light cream. Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Chocolate Milk. 1/2 shot of Chocolate liqueur, 1/2 shot of Milk, 1 dash of Amaretto. Put the milk in the bottom, pour the Liquer on top and add the dash of amaretto. Do not mix. SLAM IT!

This is called the Chocolate Black Russian. 1 oz of Kahlua, 1/2 oz of Vodka, 5 oz of Chocolate ice-cream. Combine all ingredients in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a chilled champagne flute and serve.
This is called the White Lady. 4cl of Gin, 3cl of Triple Sec, 2cl of Lemon Juice. Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into large cocktail glass.

This is called the Whiskey Sour. 2 oz of Blended whiskey, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon, 1/2 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1 of Cherry, 1/2 slice of Lemon. Shake with ice. Strain into chilled glass, garnish and serve. If served 'On the rocks', strain ingredients into old-fashioned glass filled with ice.
This is called the Flying Scotchman. 1 oz of Scotch, 1 oz of Sweet Vermouth, 1 dash of Bitters, 1/4 tsp of Sugar syrup. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Flaming Dr. Pepper. 1 oz of Amaretto, 1 oz of Vodka, 1 oz Bacardi of 151 proof rum, 1 oz of Dr. Pepper, 1 oz of Beer. Add Amaretto, Bacardi, and vodka. Mix in the Dr. Pepper and beer

This is called the Flaming Lamborghini. 1 oz of Kahlua, 1 oz of Sambuca, 1 oz of Blue Curacao, 1 oz of Bailey's irish cream. Pour the Sambuca and Kahlua into the Cocktail Glass and give the drinker a straw. Pour the Baileys and Blue Curacao into two sepsrate shot glasses either side of the cocktail glass. Set light the concotion in the cocktail glass and start to drink through the straw (this drink should be drunk in one) , as the bottom of the glass is reached put out the fire by pouring the Baileys and Blue Curacao into the cocktail glass and keep drinking till it's all gone!!

This is called the Texas Rattlesnake. 1 part of Yukon Jack, 1/2 part of Cherry brandy, 1 part of Southern Comfort, 1 splash of Sweet and sour. Mix all ingredients and Shake well. Sweet at first, with a BITE at the end...
This is called the Tennesee Mud. 8 oz of Coffee, 4 oz of Jack Daniels, 4 oz of Amaretto,  Whipped cream. Mix Coffee, Jack Daniels and Amaretto. Add Cream on top.
This is called the Cuba Libre. 2 oz of Light rum, Juice of 1/2 of Lime, None of Coca-Cola. Build all ingredients in a Collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.
This is called the Snake Bite (UK). 1/2 pint of Lager, 1/2 pint sweet or dry of Cider. Pour ingredients into a pint glass. Drink. Fall over.
This is called the Smut. 1/3 part of Red wine, 1 shot of Peach schnapps, 1/3 part of Pepsi Cola, 1/3 part of Orange juice. Throw it all together and serve real cold.
This is called the Sloe Gin Cocktail. 2 oz of Sloe gin, 1/4 tsp of Dry Vermouth, 1 dash of Orange bitters. Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Cranberry Punch. 4 cups of Cranberry juice, 1 1/2 cup of Sugar, 4 cups of Pineapple juice, 1 tblsp of Almond flavoring, 2 qt of Ginger ale. Combine first four ingredients. Stir until sugar is dissolved, chill. Then add ginger ale just before serving. Add ice ring to keep punch cold.

This is called the Sherry Eggnog. 2 oz cream of Sherry, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1 whole of Egg,  Milk,  of Nutmeg. Shake sherry, powdered sugar, and egg with ice and strain into a collins glass. Fill with milk and stir. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

This is called the Shanghai Cocktail. 1 oz Jamaican of Light rum, 1 tsp of Anisette, 1/2 tsp of Grenadine, Juice of 1/4 of Lemon. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
This is called the French Connection. 1 1/2 oz of Cognac, 3/4 oz of Amaretto. Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

This is called the French "75". 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 2 tsp superfine of Sugar, 1 1/2 oz of Lemon juice, 4 oz Chilled of Champagne, 1 of Orange, 1 of Maraschino cherry. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, sugar, and lemon juice. Shake well. Pour into a collins glass. Top with the Champagne. Stir well and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.
This is called the Freddy Kruger. 1/2 oz of Jägermeister, 1/2 oz of Sambuca, 1/2 oz of Vodka. make it an ample size shot!!

This is called the Frappé. 1/2 cup black of Coffee, 1/2 cup of Milk, 1-2 tsp of Sugar. Mix together. Blend at highest blender speed for about 1 minute. Pour into a glass and drink with a straw. Notes: This works best if everything is cold (if you make fresh coffee, mix it with the milk and let it sit in the fridge for 1/2 hour. If it is not frothy, add more milk, or even just some more milk powder. The froth gradually turns to liquid at the bottom of the glass, so you will find that you can sit and drink this for about 1/2 hour, with more iced coffee continually appearing at the bottom. Very refreshing.

This is called the Thai Coffee. 6 tblsp ground of Coffee, 1/4 tsp of Coriander, 4-5 whole green of Cardamom, None of Sugar, None of Whipping cream, None of Ice. Place the coffee and spices in the filter cone of your coffee maker. Brew coffee as usual, let it cool. In a tall glass, dissolve 1 or 2 teaspoons of sugar in an ounce of the coffee (it's easier to dissolve than if you put it right over ice). Add 5-6 ice cubes and pour coffee to within about 1 inch of the top of the glass. Rest a spoon on top of the coffee and slowly pour whipping cream into the spoon. This will make the cream float on top of the coffee rather than dispersing into it right away.
This is called the Espresso Martini. 5 cl of Vodka, 1 cl of Kahlua, 1 dash of Sugar syrup. Pour ingredients into shaker filled with ice, shake vigorously, and strain into chilled martini glass
This is called the Talos Coffee. 3 parts of Grand Marnier, 1 part of Coffee. Add your GM and then add your coffee.
This is called the Sweet Tooth. 2 shots of Godiva liqueur,  Milk. Put 2 shots Godiva Liquour into a glass, add as much or as little milk as you would like.

This is called the Strawberry Margarita. 1/2 oz of Strawberry schnapps, 1 oz of Tequila, 1/2 oz of Triple sec, 1 oz of Lemon juice, 1 oz of Strawberries,  Salt. Rub rim of cocktail glass with lemon juice and dip rim in salt. Shake schnapps, tequila, triple sec, lemon juice, and strawberries with ice, strain into the salt-rimmed glass, and serve.

This is called the Strawberry Daiquiri. 1/2 oz of Strawberry schnapps, 1 oz of Light rum, 1 oz of Lime juice, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1 oz of Strawberries. Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail glass.

This is called the Thai Iced Tea. 1/4 cup Thai of Tea, 1/2 cup boiling of Water, 2 tsp sweetened of Condensed milk,  cubes Ice,  of Mint. Combine Thai tea (i.e., the powder), boiling water, and sweetened condensed milk, stir until blended. Pour into 2 tall glasses filled with ice cubes. Garnish with mint leaves. Makes 2 servings.

This is called the Tomato Tang. 2 cups of Tomato juice, 1-2 tblsp of Lemon juice, 1 dash of Celery salt. Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
This is called the Zinger. 4 shots of Peachtree schnapps, 4 shots of Surge. Get a shot glass and pour in three shots of the schnapps. Do the same with the Surge Cola. Then down it like Scheetz would.

This is called the Tequila Sunrise. 2 measures of Tequila, None of Orange juice, None of Grenadine. Pour the tequila and orange juice into glass over ice. Add the grenadine, which will sink to the bottom. Stir gently to create the sunrise effect. Garnish and serve.

This is called the French Martini. 4.5 cl of Vodka, 1.5 cl of Raspberry Liqueur, 1.5 cl of pineapple juice. Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink.
This is called the Van Vleet. 3 oz of Light rum, 1 oz of Maple syrup, 1 oz of Lemon juice. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.

This is called the Tom Collins. 2 oz of Gin, 1 oz of Lemon juice, 1 tsp superfine of Sugar, 3 oz of Club soda, 1 of Maraschino cherry, 1 of Orange. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass alomst filled with ice cubes. Add the club soda. Stir and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.
This is called the Surf City Lifesaver. 1 part of Ouzo, 1 part of Bailey's irish cream, 2 parts of Gin, 1/2 part of Grand Marnier. Lots of ice and soda top up in tall glass with cherry and a grin.
This is called the Vesper. 6 cl of Gin, 1.5 cl of Vodka, 0.75 cl of Lillet Blanc. Shake over ice until well chilled, then strain into a deep goblet and garnish with a thin slice of lemon peel.

This is called the Sunny Holiday Punch. 46 oz chilled of Pineapple juice, 28 oz of Club soda, 6 oz frozen of Orange juice, 1 of Lemon, 2 cups of Berries, 1 bottle of Champagne. Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl.

This is called the Zizi Coin-coin. 5 cl of Cointreau, 2 cl of Lemon juice,  cubes Ice,  or lime Lemon. Pour 5cl of Cointreau on ice, add 2cl of fresh lemon (or lime) juice, stir gently, and finally add slices of lemon/lime in glass.
This is called the Zima Blaster. 12 oz of Zima, 3 oz of Chambord raspberry liqueur. Fill glass with ice. Pour in Chambord, then fill with Zima. Mix and enjoy.
This is called the Zambeer. 1 1/2 oz of Sambuca, Add 10 oz of Root beer,  cubes Ice. Mix sambuca with rootbeer and stir. Add ice

This is called the Yoghurt Cooler. 1 cup of Yoghurt, 1 cup of Fruit,  Ice. Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up. Note: Use lots of ice in this one - great on hot days! To add ice: Remove the center of the cover while the blender is on - drop 3 or 4 ice cubs and blend until they're completely crushed.
This is called the Yellow Bird. 3 cl of White Rum, 1.5 cl of Galliano, 1.5 cl of Triple Sec, 1.5 cl of Lime Juice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass
This is called the Zorro. 2 cl of Sambuca, 2 cl of Bailey's irish cream, 2 cl of White Creme de Menthe. add all and pour black coffee and add whipped cream on top.

This is called the Shark Attack. 1 can of Lemonade, 3 cans of Water, 1 1/2 cup of Vodka. Mix lemonade and water according to instructions on back of can. If the instructions say to add 4 1/3 cans of water do so. Mix into pitcher. Add 1 1/2 cup of Vodka (Absolut). Mix well. Pour into glass of crushed ice. Excellent!
This is called the Clover Club. 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 2 tsp of Grenadine, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon, 1 of Egg white. Dry shake ingredients to emulsify, add ice, shake and served straight up.

This is called the Scottish Highland Liqueur. 1 fifth of Johnnie Walker, 1 1/2 cup mild of Honey, 2 tsp dried and chopped of Angelica root, 1/4 tsp crushed of Fennel seeds, 2 2 inch strips of Lemon peel. Combine all ingreds in aging container. Cover tightly and shake gently several times during the first 24 hrs. After 24 hrs, remove the lemon zest. Cover again and let stand in a cool, dark place for 2 weeks, shaking gently every other day. Strain through a wire sieve to remove the angelica root and fennel. Return to aging container, cover and let stand undisturbed in a cool dark place for 6 months. Siphon or pour clear liqueur into a sterile bottle. The cloudy dregs may be saved for cooking.

This is called the Chocolate Beverage. 6 cups of Milk, 3 oz Mexican of Chocolate, 1 tsp powdered of Cinnamon, 3 of Egg. Boil milk in the top of a deep double boiler five minutes. Remove from fire and add chocolate, mixed with the cinnamon, a little at a time, beating with molinillo or egg beater after each addition. When the chocolate is thoroughly blended, heat to the boiling point. Place over bottom of double boiler and add eggs, whipping constantly, until they are thoroughly blended and the mixture is frothing. Serve in coffee mug. Serves eight.

This is called the Rum Toddy. 2 oz light or dark of Rum, 2 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1 twist of of Lemon peel, 2 tsp of Water. Dissolve powdered sugar in water in an old-fashioned glass. Add rum and one ice cube and stir. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
This is called the Red Snapper. 1 shot of Crown Royal, 1 shot of Amaretto, 1 shot of Cranberry juice. One shot each, shake n shoot

This is called the Radioactive Long Island Iced Tea. 1 oz of Rum, 1 oz of Vodka, 1 oz of Tequila, 1 oz of Gin, 1 oz of Triple sec, 1 oz of Chambord raspberry liqueur, 1 oz of Midori melon liqueur, 1 oz of Malibu rum. Pour all ingredients over ice in a very tall glass. Sip cautiously.

This is called the Quick-sand. 25 ml of Black Sambuca, Add 250 ml of Orange juice. Simply add the orange juice, quite a quick pour in order to mix the sambucca with the orange juice. The juice MUST have fruit pulp!

This is called the Quentin. 1 1/2 oz of Dark rum, 1/2 oz of Kahlua, 1 oz of Light cream, 1/8 tsp grated of Nutmeg. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, Kahlua, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the nutmeg.

This is called the Bramble. 4 cl of Gin, 1.5 cl of lemon juice, 1 cl of Sugar syrup, 1.5 cl of Creme de Mure. Fill glass with crushed ice. Build gin, lemon juice and simple syrup over. Stir, and then pour blackberry liqueur over in a circular fashion to create marbling effect. Garnish with two blackberries and lemon slice.

This is called the Brandy Alexander. 1 oz of Brandy, 1 oz white of Creme de Cacao, 1 oz of Light cream,  Nutmeg. Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
This is called the Pysch Vitamin Light. 1 part of Orange juice, 1 part of Apple juice, 1 part of Pineapple juice,  Ice. Shake with ice.

This is called the Popped cherry. 2 oz of Vodka, 2 oz of Cherry liqueur, 4 oz of Cranberry juice, 4 oz of Orange juice. Served over ice in a tall glass with a popped cherry (can add more popped cherries if in the mood)!

This is called the Port And Starboard. 1 tblsp of Grenadine, 1/2 oz of Green Creme de Menthe. Pour carefully into a pousse-cafe glass, so that creme de menthe floats on grenadine. Serve without mixing.

This is called the Pisco Sour. 2 oz of Pisco, 1 oz of Lemon juice, 1-2 tblsp of Sugar, None of Ice. Vigorously shake and strain contents in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes, then pour into glass and garnish with bitters.[1]
This is called the Pink Panty Pulldowns. 1 L of Sprite, 2 cups of Pink lemonade, 2 cups of Vodka. Shake well
This is called the Bob Marley. 1/2 oz of Midori melon liqueur, 1/2 oz of Jägermeister, 1/2 oz of Goldschlager. Layer in a 2 oz shot glass or pony glass

This is called the Bobby Burns Cocktail. 1 1/2 oz of Sweet Vermouth, 1 1/2 oz of Scotch, 1 1/4 tsp of Benedictine, 1 twist of of Lemon peel. Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

This is called the Pink Gin. 3 dashes of Bitters, 2 oz of Gin. Pour the bitters into a wine glass. Swirl the glass to coat the inside with the bitters, shake out the excess. Pour the gin into the glass. Do not add ice.
This is called the Pina Colada. 3 oz of Light rum, 3 tblsp of Coconut milk, 3 tblsp of Pineapple. Mix with crushed ice in blender until smooth. Pour into chilled glass, garnish and serve.
This is called the Caribbean Boilermaker. 1 bottle of Corona, 1 shot of Light rum. Pour the Corona into an 18oz beer glass pour the rum into the beer.
This is called the Campari Beer. 1 bottle of Lager, 1 1/2 cl of Campari. Use a 15 oz glass. Add Campari first. Fill with beer.
This is called the Caipirissima. 2 of Lime, 2 tblsp of Sugar, 2-3 oz of White rum, crushed of Ice. Same as Caipirinha but instead of cachaca you add WHITE RUM. It's great!!!!!!!!
This is called the Ruby Tuesday. 2 oz of Gin, 5 oz of Cranberry juice, 2 splashes of Grenadine. Pour gin and cranberry into a highball filled with ice cubes. Add grenadine and stir.
This is called the Cafe Savoy.  Coffee, 1/2 oz of Milk, 1/2 oz of Triple sec,  of Brandy. Fill mug almost to top with coffee.Add milk, triple sec and brandy. Stir.

This is called the Royal Gin Fizz. 2 oz of Gin, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1 whole of Egg,  Carbonated water. Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
This is called the Buccaneer. 1 of Corona, 1 shot of Bacardi Limon. Pour the corona into an 18oz beer glass pour the bacardi limon into the beer stir very gently
This is called the Royal Bitch. 1 part of Frangelico, 1 part of Crown Royal. Into a shot glass layer the Crown Royal on top of the Frangelico.

This is called the Rose. 1/2 oz of Dry Vermouth, 1 oz of Gin, 1/2 oz of Apricot brandy, 1/2 tsp of Lemon juice, 1 tsp of Grenadine, None of Powdered sugar. Shake together in a cocktail shaker, then strain into chilled glass. Garnish and serve.
This is called the Raspberry Cooler. 2 oz of Raspberry vodka, 4 oz of Lemon-lime soda,  Ice. Pour the raspberry vodka and soda into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

This is called the Gin Cooler. 2 oz of Gin,  Carbonated water,  Powdered sugar,  Orange spiral,  Lemon peel. Stir powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice and add gin. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the lemon peel and the orange spiral so that the end of the orange spiral dangles over rim of glass.
This is called the Tequila Surprise. full glass of Tequila, About 8 drops of Tabasco sauce. Fill shot glass with Tequila. Add drops of Tobasco sauce.

This is called the Dubonnet Cocktail. 1 1/2 oz of Dubonnet Rouge, 3/4 oz of Gin, 1 dash of Bitters, 1 twist of of Lemon peel. Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.

This is called the Sweet Bananas. 2 cups of Milk, 1 of Banana, 1 tblsp of Honey. Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
This is called the Dragonfly. 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 4 oz of Ginger ale, 1 of Lime. In a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and ginger ale. Stir well. Garnish with the lime wedge.

This is called the Tequila Fizz. 2 oz of Tequila, 1 tblsp of Lemon juice, 3/4 oz of Grenadine, 1 of Egg white,  Ginger ale. Shake all ingredients (except ginger ale) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.

This is called the Snowball. 1 1/2 oz of Advocaat, 8-10 oz cold of Lemonade, 1 slice of Lemon,  cubes Ice. Place one ice cube in the glass and add 1 1/2 oz of Advocaat. Fill up the glass with lemonade and decorate with a slice of lemon. Serve at once.
This is called the Stinger. 1 1/2 oz of Brandy, 1/2 oz of White Creme de Menthe. Pour in a mixing glass with ice, stir and strain into a cocktail glass. May also be served on rocks in a rocks glass.

This is called the Snakebite and Black. 1/2 pint of Lager, 1/2 pint of Cider, A little bit of of Blackcurrant squash. Put blackcurrant squash in first up to about 1cm in glass. Then add the larger and cider one after another.
This is called the Sidecar Cocktail. 1 oz of Brandy, 1/2 oz of Triple sec, Juice of 1/4 of Lemon. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Sherry Flip. 1 1/2 oz cream of Sherry, 2 tsp of Light cream, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1 whole of Egg,  Nutmeg. Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
This is called the Grape lemon pineapple Smoothie. 1 cup of Grapes, 1/4 of Lemon, 1/2 of Pineapple. Throw everything into a blender and liquify.
This is called the Grand Blue. 1 1/2 cl of Malibu rum, 1 1/2 cl of Peach schnapps, 1 1/2 cl of Blue Curacao, 3 cl of Sweet and sour. Serve in an old fashioned glass.
This is called the Godchild. 1 oz of Vodka, 1 oz of Amaretto, 1 oz of Heavy cream. Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a champagne flute, and serve.
This is called the ACID. 1 oz Bacardi of 151 proof rum, 1 oz of Wild Turkey. Poor in the 151 first followed by the 101 served with a Coke or Dr Pepper chaser.

This is called the Abbey Martini. 2 shots of Gin, 1 shot of Sweet Vermouth, 1 shot of Orange Juice, 3 dashes of Angostura Bitters. Put all ingredients into a shaker and mix, then strain contents into a chilled cocktail glass.
This is called the ABC. 1/3 of Amaretto, 1/3 of Bailey's irish cream, 1/3 of Cognac. Layered in a shot glass.

This is called the A midsummernight dream. 2 oz of Vodka, 1 oz of Kirschwasser, 1 tsp of Strawberry liqueur, 5 of Strawberries,  Schweppes Russchian. Mix the strawberrys in a blender Pour it together with the vodka,kirch and strawberry liquer over ice in a shaker. Shake well and pour in a highballglass. Fill up with the Russchian water

This is called the A Furlong Too Late. 2 oz of Light rum, 4 oz of Ginger beer, 1 twist of of Lemon peel. Pour the rum and ginger beer into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lemon twist.
This is called the 24k nightmare. 1/2 oz of Goldschlager, 1/2 oz of Jägermeister, 1/2 oz of Rumple Minze, 1/2 oz Bacardi of 151 proof rum. Add over ice,shake and pour.

This is called the Gin Sour. 2 oz of Gin, 1 oz of Lemon juice, 1/2 tsp superfine of Sugar, 1 of Orange, 1 of Maraschino cherry. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.

This is called the Bloody Maria. 1 oz of Tequila, 2 oz of Tomato juice, 1 dash of Lemon juice, 1 dash of Tabasco sauce, 1 dash of Celery salt, 1 slice of Lemon. Shake all ingredients (except lemon slice) with cracked ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of lemon and serve.

This is called the Orgasm. 1/2 oz white of Creme de Cacao, 1/2 oz of Amaretto, 1/2 oz of Triple sec, 1/2 oz of Vodka, 1 oz of Light cream. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass, and serve.
This is called the Orange Crush. 1 oz of Vodka, 1 oz of Triple sec, 1 oz of Orange juice. Add all ingredients to tumbler-Pour as shot

This is called the Bellini Martini. 8 cubes of Ice, 3 oz of Vodka, 1.5 oz of Peach nectar, 1.5 oz of Peach schnapps, 1 of Lemon peel. Add ice cubes to shaker.
Add vodka.
Add peach schnapps.
Add peach nectar.
Shake.
Strain into glass.
Add lemon twist peel.

This is called the Banana Daiquiri. 1 1/2 oz of Light rum, 1 tblsp of Triple sec, 1 of Banana, 1 1/2 oz of Lime juice, 1 tsp of Sugar, 1 of Cherry. Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail glass.

This is called the Baby Guinness. 2 1/2 oz of Kahlua, 1/2 oz of Bailey's irish cream. Pour Kahlua, almost filling shot glass. Then, carefully pour Baileys, using wall of shot glass. This will give the "Guinness" its "head".

This is called the Mojito. 2-3 oz of Light rum, Juice of 1 of Lime, 2 tsp of Sugar, 2-4 of Mint, None of Soda water. Muddle mint leaves with sugar and lime juice. Add a splash of soda water and fill the glass with cracked ice. Pour the rum and top with soda water. Garnish and serve with straw.
This is called the B-52. 1/3 of Bailey's irish cream, 1/3 of Grand Marnier, 1/4 of Kahlua. Layer ingredients into a shot glass. Serve with a stirrer.

This is called the Aviation. 4.5 cl of Gin, 1.5 cl of lemon juice, 1.5 cl of maraschino liqueur. Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.

This is called the Avalon. 3 parts of Vodka, 1 part of Pisang Ambon, 6 parts of Apple juice, 1 1/2 part of Lemon juice,  Lemonade. Fill a tall glass with ice. Layer the Finlandia Vodka, lemon and apple juices, Pisang Ambon, and top up with lemonade. Stir slightly and garnish with a spiralled cucumber skin and a red cherry. The cucumber provides zest and looks attractive. This drink, created by Timo Haimi, took first prize in the 1991 Finlandia Vodka Long Drink Competition.

This is called the Grasshopper. 3/4 oz of Green Creme de Menthe, 3/4 oz white of Creme de Cacao, 3/4 oz of Light cream. Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake briskly and then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

This is called the Grass Skirt. 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 1 oz of Triple sec, 1 oz of Pineapple juice, 1/2 tsp of Grenadine, 1 of Pineapple. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, triple sec, pineapple juice, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the pineapple slice.

This is called the Gagliardo. 5 parts of Peach Vodka, 3 parts of Lemon juice, 1 part of Galliano, 1 part of Sirup of roses. Shake well and serve in a cocktail glass. This is a home cocktail of American/Internet Bar del Pozzo, Pavia, Italy.

This is called the Girl From Ipanema. 25 ml of Cachaca, 15 ml of Lemon Juice, 10 ml of Agave Syrup, top up with of Champagne. Add the cachaca, lemon juice and syrup to your boston glass. Add ice and shake until ice cold. Pour into a chilled flute and top-up with Champagne

This is called the Gin And Tonic. 2 oz of Gin, 5 oz of Tonic water, 1 of Lime. Pour the gin and the tonic water into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lime wedge.
This is called the Absolut limousine. 2/3 of Absolut Citron, 1/3 of Lime juice, Fill with of Ice, Top it up with of Tonic water. Fill Absolut into a glass. Add Lime juice. Add Ice and lime wedges.
This is called the Absolutely Cranberry Smash. 2 oz of Absolut Vodka, 4 oz of Cranberry juice, 2 oz of Ginger ale, Add of Ice. Stir ingredients together. Serve over ice.
This is called the Hemingway Special. 12 parts of Rum, 8 parts of Grapefruit Juice, 3 parts of Maraschino Liqueur, 3 parts of Lime Juice. Pour all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake.
This is called the Hawaiian Cocktail. 2 oz of Gin, 1/2 oz of Triple sec, 1 tblsp of Pineapple juice. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Havana Cocktail. 1 oz of Light rum, 1 oz of Pineapple juice, 1 tsp of Lemon juice. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

This is called the Absolut Summertime. 1 1/2 oz of Absolut Citron, 3/4 oz of Sweet and sour, 1/2 oz of Sprite, 3 oz of Soda water, 1 slice of Lemon. Add all ingredients except lemon to shaker filled with ice. Cover and shake vigorously. Strain contents into ice filled collins glass. Garnish with lemon.

This is called the A Day at the Beach. 1 oz of Coconut rum, 1/2 oz of Amaretto, 4 oz of Orange juice, 1/2 oz of Grenadine. Shake Rum, Amaretto, and Orange Juice in a shaker filled with ice. Strain over ice into a highball glass. Add Grenadine and garnish with a Pineapple Wedge and a Strawberry.

This is called the Fruit Flip-Flop. 1 cup of Yoghurt, 1 cup of Fruit juice. Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

This is called the Gluehwein. 1 L of Red wine, 125 ml of Water, 60 gr of Sugar, 1 of Cinnamon, 3 of Cloves, 1 tblsp of Lemon peel. Boil sugar and spices in water, leave in the water for 30 minutes. Strain the spiced water and mix with the wine. Heat slowly until short of boiling temperature. (To remove alcohol, let it boil for a while.) You may add lemon or orange juice to taste. Serve in irish coffee cup.
This is called the A Piece of Ass. 1 shot of Amaretto, 1 shot of Southern Comfort,  cubes Ice,  Sour mix. Put ice in glass. Pour in shots. Fill with Sour Mix.

This is called the Gin Smash. 2 oz of Gin, 1 oz of Carbonated water, 1 cube of Sugar, 4 of Mint, 1 slice of Orange, 1 of Cherry. Muddle sugar with carbonated water and mint sprigs in an old-fashioned glass. Add gin and 1 ice cube. Stir, add the orange slice and the cherry, and serve.
This is called the A Gilligan's Island. 1 oz of Vodka, 1 oz of Peach schnapps, 3 oz of Orange juice, 3 oz of Cranberry juice. Shaken, not stirred!

This is called the Midnight Mint. 1 oz of Bailey's irish cream, 3/4 oz of White Creme de Menthe, 3/4 oz double of Cream. If available, rim cocktail (Martini) glass with sugar syrup then dip into chocolate flakes or powder. Add ingredients into shaker with ice. Shake well then strain into cocktail glass.
This is called the Avalanche. 1 shot of Crown Royal, 1 shot of Kahlua, Fill with of Cream. Mix in highball glass over ice, shake well.

This is called the Midnight Cowboy. 2 oz of Bourbon, 1 oz of Dark rum, 1/2 oz of Heavy cream. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
This is called the Auburn Headbanger. 1 oz of Jägermeister, 1 oz of Goldschlager. Mix in spread glass over ice. Strain and pour in shot glass. Sit down before shotting. ENJOY!!

This is called the Atlantic Sun. 2 cl Smirnoff of Vodka, 2 cl of Southern Comfort, 2 cl of Passion fruit syrup, 6 cl of Sweet and sour, 1 dash of Club soda. Shake all the ingredients, top the drink with soda. Garnish with a slice of orange.

This is called the Mary Pickford. 1 1/2 oz of Light rum, 1 oz of Pineapple juice, 1/2 tsp of Maraschino liqueur, 1/2 tsp of Grenadine, 1 of Maraschino cherry. Shake and strain into a chilled large cocktail glass
This is called the Mango Orange Smoothie. 1 of Mango, 2 of Orange. Throw everything into a blender and liquify.

This is called the Archbishop. 2 oz of Gin, 1 oz Green Ginger of Wine, 1 tsp of Benedictine, 1 of Lime. In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well.

This is called the Long Island Tea. 1/2 oz of Vodka, 1/2 oz of Light rum, 1/2 oz of Gin, 1/2 oz of Tequila, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon, 1 splash of Coca-Cola. Combine all ingredients (except cola) and pour over ice in a highball glass. Add the splash of cola for color. Decorate with a slice of lemon and serve.
This is called the Applecar. 1 oz of Applejack, 1 oz of Triple sec, 1 oz of Lemon juice. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Frozen Pineapple Daiquiri. 1 1/2 oz of Light rum, 4 chunks of Pineapple, 1 tblsp of Lime juice, 1/2 tsp of Sugar. Combine all ingredients with 1 cup of crushed ice in an electric blender. Blend at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a champagne flute and serve.

This is called the Fruit Cooler. 1 can frozen of Apple juice, 1 cup of Strawberries, 2 tblsp of Sugar, 1 of Lemon, 1 of Apple, 1 L of Soda water,  Ice. Toss strawberries with sugar, and let sit overnight in refrigerator. Cut lemon, reserve two slices. Juice the rest. Mix together the lemon juice, strawberries, apple juice, and soda water. Add slices of lemon (decor, really). In glasses, put ice cubes, and a slice of apple. Pour drink in, and serve.
This is called the 155 Belmont. 1 shot of Dark rum, 2 shots of Light rum, 1 shot of Vodka, 1 shot of Orange juice. Blend with ice. Serve in a wine glass. Garnish with carrot.
This is called the 747. 1/3 part of Kahlua, 1/3 part of Bailey's irish cream, 1/3 part of Frangelico. pour kaluha, then Baileys, then Frangelico not chilled and not layered -- SERVE!!!
This is called the 110 in the shade. 16 oz of Lager, 1.5 oz of Tequila. Drop shooter in glass. Fill with beer

This is called the Downshift. 2 part of Fruit punch, 1 part of Sprite, 2 shots of Tequila, Float Bacardi of 151 proof rum. Start with the Sprite. Next comes the tequila. After that, add the Minute Maid Fruit Punch, then float the 151. Rocks optional.
This is called the Stone Sour. 1 oz of Apricot brandy, 1 oz of Orange juice, 1 oz of Sweet and sour. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled whiskey sour glass, and serve.
This is called the Spritz. 6 cl of Prosecco, 4 cl of Campari, splash of Soda Water. Build into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

This is called the Diesel. 1/2 pint of Lager, 1/2 pint of Cider, 1 dash of Blackcurrant cordial. Pour the lager first then add the blackcurrant cordial. Top up with the cider. The colour sholud be very dark approaching the colour of Guiness.

This is called the Spiced Peach Punch. 46 oz of Peach nectar, 20 oz of Orange juice, 1/2 cup of Brown sugar, 3 3-inch of Cinnamon, 1/2 tsp of Cloves, 2 tblsp of Lime juice. Combine peach nectar, orange juice and brown sugar in a large saucepan. Tie cinnamon and cloves in a small cheesecloth bag. Drop into saucepan. Heat slowly, stirring constantly, until sugar dissolves. Simmer 10 minutes. Stir in lime juice. Serve in hot mugs.

This is called the Derby. 6 cl of gin, 2 dashes of Peach Bitters, 2 Fresh leaves of Mint. Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice. Stir. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint in the drink.

This is called the Space Odyssey. 1 shot Bacardi of 151 proof rum, 1 shot of Malibu rum, 1 shot of Pineapple juice,  Orange juice,  Grenadine,  of Cherries. Fill glass with ice and add shots of Bacardi and Malibu. Add splash of pineapple juice and top with orange juice. Add grenadine for color and garnish with cherries.
This is called the Dark and Stormy. 5 cl of Dark Rum, 10 cl of Ginger Beer. In a highball glass filled with ice add 6cl dark rum and top with ginger beer. Garnish with lime wedge.
This is called the Damned if you do. 0.75 oz of Whiskey, 0.25 oz of Hot Damn. Pour into shot glass. Put in mouth. Repeat as deemed necessary.

This is called the Sex on the Beach. 1 oz of Vodka, 3/4 oz of Peach schnapps, None of Cranberry juice,  of Grapefruit juice. Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with orange slice.
This is called the AT&T. 1 oz of Absolut Vodka, 1 oz of Gin, 4 oz of Tonic water. Pour Vodka and Gin over ice, add Tonic and Stir

This is called the A Splash of Nash. 2 oz of Cranberry juice, 2 oz of Soda water, 0.5 oz of Midori melon liqueur, 0.5 oz of Creme de Banane. Drop shot glass with banana & melon liquers into a 9 oz hi- ball glass containing soda water and cranberry juice. Drink in one shot.

This is called the Frozen Daiquiri. 1 1/2 oz of Light rum, 1 tblsp of Triple sec, 1 1/2 oz of Lime juice, 1 tsp of Sugar, 1 of Cherry, 1 cup crushed of Ice. Combine all ingredients (except for the cherry) in an electric blender and blend at a low speed for five seconds, then blend at a high speed until firm. Pour contents into a champagne flute, top with the cherry, and serve.

This is called the Gin Daisy. 2 oz of Gin, 1 oz of Lemon juice, 1/2 tsp superfine of Sugar, 1/2 tsp of Grenadine, 1 of Maraschino cherry, 1 of Orange. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the wine, lemon juice, sugar, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.
This is called the Fuzzy Asshole. 1/2 of Coffee, 1/2 of Peach schnapps. fill coffe mug half full of coffee. Fill the other half full of Peach Schnapps. Stir and drink while hot.
This is called the 410 Gone. 2-3 oz of Peach Vodka, None of Coca-Cola. None

This is called the 3-Mile Long Island Iced Tea. 1/2 oz of Gin, 1/2 oz of Light rum, 1/2 oz of Tequila, 1/2 oz of Triple sec, 1/2 oz of Vodka,  Coca-Cola, 1-2 dash of Sweet and sour, 1 wedge of Bitters,  of Lemon. Fill 14oz glass with ice and alcohol. Fill 2/3 glass with cola and remainder with sweet & sour. Top with dash of bitters and lemon wedge.

This is called the Screaming Orgasm. 1 oz of Vodka, 1 1/2 oz of Bailey's irish cream, 1/2 oz of Kahlua. Pour first vodka, then Bailey's, then Kahlua into a cocktail glass over crushed ice. Stir. Caution: use only high quality vodka. Cheap vodka can cause the Bailey's to curdle. Test your brand of vodka by mixing 1 Tsp each of vodka and Bailey's first.
This is called the Citrus Coke. 1 part of Bacardi Limon, 2 parts of Coca-Cola. Pour half of coke in a glass. Then add Bacardi and top it off with the remaining coke. Stir and drink up!

This is called the Sangria - The World's Best. 1 1/2 L of Red wine, 1 cup of Sugar, 1 large of Lemon, 1 large of Orange, 1 large of Apple, 3-4 oz plain of Brandy,  Soda water. Mix wine, sugar and fruit, and let sit in the fridge for 18-24 hours. The mixture will have a somewhat syrupy consistency. Before serving stir in brandy and cut the mixture with soda water until it have a thinner, more wine like consistency. Serve from a pitcher in wine glasses.

This is called the Chocolate Drink. 125 gr of Chocolate, 3/4 L of Milk, None of Water. Melt the bar in a small amount of boiling water. Add milk. Cook over low heat, whipping gently (with a whisk, i would assume) until heated well. Don't let it boil! Serve in coffee mug.

This is called the Salty Dog. 5 oz of Grapefruit juice, 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 1/4 tsp of Salt. Pour all ingredients over ice cubes in a highball glass. Stir well and serve. (Vodka may be substituted for gin, if preferred.)
This is called the Russian Spring Punch. 2.5 cl of Vodka, 1.5 cl of Creme de Cassis, 1 cl of Sugar Syrup, 2.5 cl of Lemon Juice. Pour the ingredients into an highball glass, top with Sparkling wine.

This is called the Rum Sour. 2 oz of Light rum, 1 oz of Lemon juice, 1/2 tsp superfine of Sugar, 1 of Orange, 1 of Maraschino cherry. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.

This is called the Cherry Electric Lemonade. 1 oz of Gin, 1 oz of Tequila, 1 oz of Vodka, 1 oz of White rum, 1 oz of Triple Sec, 1 oz of Cherry Grenadine, 1 oz of Sweet and sour, 3 oz of Club soda. Now stir vigorously and then pour over a large cup of ice. Now drink it with a straw and stir occasionally.

This is called the Castillian Hot Chocolate. 1/2 cup of Cocoa powder, 1 cup of Sugar, 7 tsp of Cornstarch, 1/2 cup of Water, 1 qt of Milk. Shift the cocoa and sugar together into a medium-sized saucepan. Dissolve the cornstarch in the water, and stir into the cocoa and sugar until it is a smooth paste. Begin heating the mixture, stirring it with a whisk, and gradually pour in the milk. Continue stirring with the whisk as you bring the liquid to a simmer. Allow the chocolate to simmer for about 10 minutes, stirring often, until it is thick, glossy and completely smooth. Serve steaming hot in coffee mug. Serves six.

This is called the Caribbean Orange Liqueur. 3 large of Orange, 3 cups of Vodka, 1 1/3 cup superfine of Sugar. Pare very thinly the bright-colored rind from the oranges (no white). Blot the peel on paper towels to remove any excess oil. Put peel in a 4 cup screw-top jar. Add 2 cups vodka. Close jar. Store in a cool, dark place for 2 days or until the vodka has absorbed the flavor. Remove peel and add remaining vodka. Close jar and add remaining cup of vodka. Close the jar and store in a cool dark place at least 1 month to age.
