This is called the Cosmopolitan. 1 1/4 oz of Absolut Citron, 1/4 oz of Lime juice, 1/4 oz of Cointreau, 1/4 cup of Cranberry juice. Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and double strain into large cocktail glass. Garnish with lime wheel.

This is called the Coke and Drops. 1 dl of Coca-Cola, 7 drops of Lemon juice. Take a glass, pour the Coke in the glass, then you take 7 drops of lemon juice. Granish with a lemon slice on the rim of the glass.

This is called the Coffee-Vodka. 2 cups of Water, 2 cups white of Sugar, 1/2 cup instant of Coffee, 1/2 of Vanilla, 1 1/2 cup of Vodka,  Caramel coloring. Boil water and sugar until dissolved. Turn off heat. Slowly add dry instant coffee and continue stirring. Add a chopped vanilla bean to the vodka, then combine the cooled sugar syrup and coffee solution with the vodka. Cover tightly and shake vigorously each day for 3 weeks. Strain and filter. Its also best to let the sugar mixture cool completely so the vodka won't evaporate when its added. If you like a smoother feel to the liqueur you can add about 1 teaspoon of glycerine to the finished product.
This is called the Clove Cocktail. 1 oz of Sweet Vermouth, 1/2 oz of Sloe gin, 1/2 oz Muscatel of Wine. Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Classic Old-Fashioned. 3 dashes of Bitters, 1 tsp of Water, 1 of Sugar, 3 oz of Bourbon, 1 of Orange, 1 of Maraschino cherry. In an old-fashioned glass, muddle the bitters and water into the sugar cube, using the back of a teaspoon. Almost fill the glass with ice cubes and add the bourbon. Garnish with the orange slice and the cherry. Serve with a swizzle stick.

This is called the Scotch Sour. 1 1/2 oz of Scotch, Juice of 1/2 of Lime, 1/2 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1/2 slice of Lemon, 1 of Cherry. Shake scotch, juice of lime, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with 1/2 slice lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.

This is called the Scotch Cobbler. 2 oz of Scotch, 4 dashes of Brandy, 4 dashes of Curacao, 1 slice of Orange, 1 of Mint. Pour scotch, brandy, and curacao over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Add the orange slice, top with the mint sprig, and serve.

This is called the Chocolate Monkey. 1 shot of Banana liqueur, 2 shots of Creme de Cacao, 2 scoops of Chocolate ice-cream, 1 oz of Chocolate syrup, 4 oz of Chocolate milk, 1 of Whipped cream, 1 of Cherry, 1 piece of Banana. blend liqeuors with ice-cream, milk and syrup. pour into parfait glass, top with whipped cream and garnish with banana and cherry.

This is called the Sazerac. 1 tsp of Ricard, 1/2 tsp superfine of Sugar, 2 dashes of Peychaud bitters, 1 tsp of Water, 2 oz of Bourbon, 1 twist of of Lemon peel. Rinse a chilled old-fashioned glass with the absinthe, add crushed ice, and set it aside. Stir the remaining ingredients over ice and set it aside. Discard the ice and any excess absinthe from the prepared glass, and strain the drink into the glass. Add the lemon peel for garnish.

This is called the San Francisco. 2 cl of Vodka, 2 cl of Creme de Banane,  Grenadine,  of Orange juice. Take a tall glass and put in a few ice cubes, fill the vodka over it and fill with juice then the "creme", to end fill in the grenadine but very carefully at the side of the glass so it will lay down in the bottom. garnish with orange and strawberry.

This is called the Arizona Twister. 1 shot of Vodka, 1 shot of Malibu rum, 1 shot of Gold tequila, 1 splash of Orange juice, 1 splash of Pineapple juice, 1 splash of Cream of coconut, 1 dash of Grenadine, crushed of Ice, 1 wedge of Pineapple. Just mix in the shots of rum, vodka, and tequila. Add splashes of the three juices, heavy on the pineapple. Top off with grenadine. Crushed ice should already be in glass. Top off the glass with a pineapple wedge.
This is called the Malibu Twister. 2 parts of Malibu rum, 2 parts of Tropicana, 1 part of Cranberry juice. Add rum & trister then, add cranberry jucie,stir

This is called the Arctic Mouthwash. 5 oz blue of Maui, 5 oz of Mountain Dew,  cubes Ice. Blend all ingredients in a blender on high until ice is finely crushed. It should be of a slushy consistency. Pour immediately and serve.
This is called the Lord And Lady. 1 1/2 oz of Dark rum, 1/2 oz of Tia maria. Pour the rum and Tia Maria into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.

This is called the Apricot Lady. 1 1/2 oz of Light rum, 1 oz of Apricot brandy, 1 tsp of Triple sec, 1/2 oz of Lemon juice, 1 of Egg white, 1 of Orange. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, apricot brandy, triple sec, lemon juice, and egg white. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Garnish with the orange slice.

This is called the Apple Slammer. 1 part of 7-Up, 1 part of Apple schnapps. pour into a shot glass and present to consumer, they are expected to cover the top of the shotglass with thier palm, raise the glass, slam it on the bar and the swallow quickly.

This is called the Lemouroudji. 2 pieces of Ginger, 1 gal of Water, 1 lb of Lemon, 1 cup of Sugar, ground of Cayenne pepper. Juice the lemons. Peel and grate the ginger. Place the grated ginger and a liberal dash of the cayenne pepper into a piece of cheesecloth, and tie it into a knot. Let soak in the water. After 15 minutes or so, add the sugar, and the lemon juice. Chill, and serve.

This is called the Lemon Shot. 1/2 oz of Galliano, 1/2 oz of Absolut Citron,  wedge Lemon, Bacardi of Sugar,  of 151 proof rum. Mix Galliano and Absolut Citron in a shot glass, lay lemon wedge sprinkled with sugar over glass and pour a rum over wedge and glass. light rum with a lighter and let burn for a second. Do shot quickly and suck on lemon. If it is done correctly, this will taste like a shot of sweet lemonade.

This is called the Lassi - Sweet. 1 cup of Yoghurt, 2 cups cold of Water, 4 tblsp of Sugar, pinch of Salt, 2 tblsp of Lemon juice. Put all ingredients into a blender and blend until nice and frothy. Serve chilled.

This is called the Lassi - A South Indian Drink. 1/2 cup plain of Yoghurt, 1 1/4 cup cold of Water, 1/2 tsp ground roasted of Cumin seed, 1/4 tsp of Salt, 1/4 tsp dried of Mint. Blend in a blender for 3 seconds. Lassi is one of the easiest things to make, and there are many ways of making it. Basically, it is buttermilk (yoghurt whisked with water), and you can choose almost any consistency that you like, from the thinnest to the thickest. Serve cold.

This is called the Amaretto Sunrise. 1 cl of Amaretto, 4 oz of Orange juice, 1/4 cl of Grenadine. Mix together the amaretto and orange juice. Pour into glass and then add the grenadine untill you see the sunrise.

This is called the Amaretto Stone Sour #3. 2 oz of Sour mix, 2 oz of Amaretto, 2 oz of Tequila, Add splash of Orange juice. Shake sour mix, tequila and amaretto with ice. Strain into highball glass. Add a splash of OJ. Garnish with orange slice and a cherry.
This is called the Kiwi Lemon. 1 part of Kiwi liqueur, 2 parts of Bitter lemon,  cubes Ice. Mix in highball glass. Stirr. Garnish with slice of kiwi.
This is called the Kir Royale. 1 part of Creme de Cassis, 5 parts of Champagne. Pour Creme de cassis in glass, gently pour champagne on top
This is called the Kentucky B And B. 2 oz of Bourbon, 1/2 oz of Benedictine. Pour the bourbon and Benedictine into a brandy snifter.
This is called the Almond Joy. 1/2 oz of Amaretto, 1/2 oz white of Creme de Cacao, 2 oz of Light cream. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Allegheny. 1 oz of Dry Vermouth, 1 oz of Bourbon, 1 1/2 tsp of Blackberry brandy, 1 1/2 tsp of Lemon juice, 1 twist of of Lemon peel. Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the twist of lemon peel and serve.
This is called the Alice Cocktail. 1 cl of Grenadine, 1 cl of Orange juice, 2 cl of Pineapple juice, 4 cl of Cream. Shake well, strain into a large cocktail glass.

This is called the Alaska Cocktail. 2 dashes of Orange bitters, 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 3/4 oz of Yellow Chartreuse, Twist of of Lemon peel. Stir all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass. Drop in a twist of lemon and serve.

This is called the Irish Russian. 1 shot of Vodka, 1 shot of Kahlua, 1 dash of Coca-Cola, Fill with of Guinness stout. Add the ingredients in the order listed in the recipe. Care must be taken when adding the Guinness to prevent an excess of foam. Do Not add ice.

This is called the Bourbon Sling. 1 tsp superfine of Sugar, 2 tsp of Water, 1 oz of Lemon juice, 2 oz of Bourbon, 1 twist of of Lemon peel. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the sugar, water, lemon juice, and bourbon. Shake well. Strain well. Strain into a highball glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

This is called the Boston Sour. 2 oz of Blended whiskey, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1 of Egg white, 1 slice of Lemon, 1 of Cherry. Shake juice of lemon, powdered sugar, blended whiskey, and egg white with cracked ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.

This is called the Blue Mountain. 1 1/2 oz of Añejo rum, 1/2 oz of Tia maria, 1/2 oz of Vodka, 1 oz of Orange juice, 1 tsp of Lemon juice. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass alomst filled with ice cubes.
This is called the Owen's Grandmother's Revenge. 12 oz of Whiskey, 12 oz of Beer, 12 oz frozen of Lemonade, 1 cup crushed of Ice. Add ingredients and mix in blender.

This is called the Orange Oasis. 1/2 oz of Cherry brandy, 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 4 oz of Orange juice,  Ginger ale. Shake brandy, gin, and orange juice with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.
This is called the Black Forest Shake.  cubes Ice,  Chocolate syrup,  Cherry brandy,  Vodka,  Milk. In a blender put ice cubes, chocolate syrup, cherry brandy, vodka, and milk. Blend very well.

This is called the Between The Sheets. 1 oz of Brandy, 1 oz of Light rum, 1 oz of Triple sec, 1 oz of Lemon juice. Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes, shake, strain into chilled cocktail glass.
This is called the Bellini. 6 oz of Champagne, 1 oz of Peach schnapps. Pour peach purée into chilled flute, add sparkling wine. Stir gently.

This is called the New York Lemonade. 2 oz of Absolut Citron, 1 oz of Grand Marnier, 2 oz sweetened of Lemon juice, 1 oz of Club soda. Serve in a chilled cocktail glass. Lemon and sugar the rim. Stir and Strain.

This is called the Banana Milk Shake. 10 cl cold of Milk, 4 cl of Orange juice, 2 tsp of Sugar syrup, 1/2 of Banana. Blend very well, preferably in a household mixer. Serve in a wine glass, garnish with whipped cream and a piece of banana.

This is called the Bruce's Puce.  Grenadine,  Kahlua,  Bailey's irish cream. In a regular-sized shot glass, layer, with a spoon or cherry, the grenadine , the Kahlua , then the Bailey's Irish cream in equal portions. It goes down really smooth ,and you don't even need a chaser. It tastes just like chocolate milk.(Really!)
This is called the Radler. 12 oz of Beer, 12 oz of 7-Up. Pour beer into large mug, slowly add the 7-up (or Sprite).

This is called the Brandon and Will's Coke Float. 2 scoops of Vanilla ice-cream, 1 can of Coca-Cola, 2 oz of Bourbon. Scoop two large scoops of vanilla ice-cream into frosted beer mug. Next, add 2 ounces Maker's Mark. Then, pour in coke. Gently stir and enjoy.
This is called the Quarter Deck Cocktail. 1 1/2 of Light rum, 1/3 oz cream of Sherry, Juice of 1/2 of Lime. Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
This is called the Port Wine Cocktail. 2 1/2 oz of Port, 1/2 tsp of Brandy. Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Bora Bora. 10 cl of Pineapple juice, 6 cl of Passion fruit juice, 1 cl of Lemon juice, 1 cl of Grenadine. Prepare in a blender or shaker, serve in a highball glass on the rocks. Garnish with 1 slice of pineapple and one cherry.

This is called the Blue Margarita. 1 1/2 oz of Tequila, 1 oz of Blue Curacao, 1 oz of Lime juice, Coarse of Salt. Rub rim of cocktail glass with lime juice. Dip rim in coarse salt. Shake tequila, blue curacao, and lime juice with ice, strain into the salt-rimmed glass, and serve.
This is called the Blue Lagoon. 1 oz of Vodka, 1 oz of Blue Curacao,  Lemonade,  Cherry. Pour vodka and curacao over ice in a highball glass. Fill with lemonade, top with the cherry, and serve.

This is called the Bleeding Surgeon. 1 shot of Dark rum, 1 slice of Orange, 1/2 glass of Surge, 1/2 glass of Cranberry juice. Pour Shot of Rum over slice of orange. Fill the remaining space in glass half way full of surge or similar drink. Finish off glass with cranberry juice. Be carefull, warm surge may foam over the glass.

This is called the Oreo Mudslide. 1 oz of Vodka, 1 oz of Kahlua, 1 oz of Bailey's irish cream, 2 scoops of Vanilla ice-cream, 1 of Oreo cookie. Blend Vodka, Kahlua, Bailey's, ice-cream and the Oreo well in a blender. Pour into a large frosted glass. Garnish with whipped cream and a cherry.

This is called the Masala Chai. 2 cups of Water, 3-4 tsp of Tea, 1 chunk dried of Ginger, 3-4 crushed of Cardamom, 3 of Cloves, 1 piece of Cinnamon, 1-2 whole of Black pepper,  to taste Sugar,  of Milk. Bring 2 cups of water to boil. Add all the ingredients and boil again for about 15 seconds. Let stand for a minute. Warm milk in a pot. Filter tea into cups. Add milk and sugar. That's IT.

This is called the Martini. 1 2/3 oz of Gin, 1/3 oz of Dry Vermouth, 1 of Olive. Straight: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain in chilled martini cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with olive.

This is called the Arizona Stingers. 2 shots of Absolut Vodka, 12 oz lemon of Iced tea. Place ice cubes in the hurricane glass . Add the 2 HEAPING shots of Absolute Vodka (Note: You can add as many shots of Absolute as you want!) Fill the rest of glass with the Arizona Icetea with lemon. Stir to mix using a spoon. Drink up and enjoy!!!!!!!

This is called the Long Island Iced Tea. 1/2 oz of Vodka, 1/2 oz of Tequila, 1/2 oz of Light rum, 1/2 oz of Gin, 1 dash of Coca-Cola, Twist of of Lemon peel. Mix all contents in a highball glass and sitr gently. Add dash of Coca-Cola for the coloring and garnish with lemon or lime twist.

This is called the Lone Tree Cooler.  Carbonated water,  Gin,  Dry Vermouth,  Powdered sugar,  Orange spiral,  Lemon peel. Stir powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice, add gin and vermouth, and stir. Fill with carbonated water and stir again. Add the twist of lemon peel and the orange spiral so that the end dangles over rim of glass.

This is called the London Town. 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 1/2 oz of Maraschino liqueur, 2 dashes of Orange bitters. In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
This is called the Apello. 4 cl of Orange juice, 3 cl of Grapefruit juice, 1 cl of Apple juice, 1 of Maraschino cherry. Stirr. Grnish with maraschino cherry.

This is called the Lassi Raita. 2 cups of Yoghurt, 4-6 of Ice,  Sugar,  Lime,  Salt. Blend the yoghurt and ice cubes together, until the yoghurt becomes more liquid. Add sugar to taste. The lemon/lime is optional but it gives it a slightly tart taste. Dash of salt. Raita is also good for the summer. Instead of having a traditional salad you can make raita instead.

This is called the Amaretto Sweet & Sour.  Amaretto,  Sweet and sour,  of Midori melon liqueur,  of Pineapple juice. Fill the blender with 3/4 ice. Add sweet & sour mix to the top of the ice. Add about 1" of pineapple juice, 1/2" of melon liqeur, and 1/2 to 1/4" of amaretto. Then blend the mix until it is of margaritta consistency or thinner.

This is called the Lassi - Mango. 2 of Mango, 2 cups of Yoghurt, 1/2 cup of Sugar, 1 cup iced of Water. Put it all in a blender and pour over crushed ice. You can also use other fruits like strawberries and bananas.

This is called the Lady Love Fizz. 2 oz of Gin, 2 tsp of Light cream, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon, 1 of Egg white,  Carbonated water. Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

This is called the Kool-Aid Slammer. 1/2 oz Grape of Kool-Aid, 1/2 oz of Vodka. Fill half the shot glass with the kool-aid first. Then put a paper towel over the top of the glass and slowly pour in the vodka. If you do it right, you should be able to see that the two liquids are separated, with the vodka on top. Now slam it! The last thing you'll taste is the kool-aid.

This is called the Just a Moonmint. 2 cups of Milk,  Chocolate syrup,  Mint syrup. Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

This is called the Amaretto Mist. 1 1/2 oz of Amaretto, 1 of Lime. Pour amaretto in an old-fashioned glass over crushed ice. Add the wedge of lime and serve. (A wedge of lemon may be substituted for lime, if preferred.)
This is called the Almond Chocolate Coffee. 3/4 oz of Amaretto, 1/2 oz of Dark Creme de Cacao, 8 oz of Coffee. Pour in order into coffee cup. Top with whipped creme and chocolate shcvings.

This is called the Jello shots. 2 cups of Vodka, 3 packages of Jello, 3 cups of Water. Boil 3 cups of water then add jello. Mix jello and water until jello is completely disolved. Add the two cups of vodka and mix together. Pour mixture into plastic shot glasses and chill until firm. Then, eat away...

This is called the Jamaica Kiss. 1 shot of Coffee liqueur, 1 shot Jamaican of Light rum,  cubes Ice,  Milk. Fill a tumbler with ice cubes. Add a shot of Tia Maria and a shot of Jamaican light rum. Fill the tumbler with milk. Blend until smooth and serve immediately.

This is called the Afternoon. 1 cl of Kahlua, 1 cl of Bailey's irish cream, 1 1/2 of Frangelico, 4 cl hot of Coffee,  Cream. Build into a suiting glass, with no ice. Cream on top if wanted. Served directly.

This is called the Adam Bomb. 1 part of Rum, 1 part of Vodka, 1 part of Tequila, 1/2 part of Triple sec,  Fruit,  Ice, 1-3 pint of Salt,  of Fruit juice. Add ice to blender (or to glass if prefer on the rocks) then fruit, and fruite juice depending on personal prefference then add the Rum, Vodka, Tequila, and triple sec. blend till smooth, rim glass with sugar or salt and pour mixture in. garnish with lemon or lime slice.

This is called the Homemade Kahlua. 2 1/2 cups of Sugar, 1 cup of Corn syrup, 1 1/2 oz instant of Coffee, 2 oz of Vanilla extract, 3 cups boiling of Water, 1 fifth of Vodka. Dissolve sugar in 2 cups of boiling water and add corn syrup. Dissolve the instant coffee in the remaining water. Pour syrup and coffee in a gallon jug. Let it cool. Add vodka and vanilla when cold. For the best result, let the mixture "mature" for 4-5 weeks.
This is called the 50/50. 2 1/2 oz of Vanilla vodka, 1 splash of Grand Marnier, Fill with of Orange juice. fill glass with crushed ice. Add vodka. Add a splash of grand-marnier. Fill with o.j.

This is called the Gin Swizzle. 1 1/2 oz of Lime juice, 1 tsp superfine of Sugar, 2 oz of Gin, 1 dash of Bitters, 3 oz of Club soda. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the lime juice, sugar, gin, and bitters. Shake well. Almost fill a colling glass with ice cubes. Stir until the glass is frosted. Strain the mixture in the shaker into the glass and add the club soda.

This is called the A True Amaretto Sour. 1 jigger of Amaretto, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon,  Ice,  of Maraschino cherry. Rub the rim of an old fashioned glass with lemon, and dip repeatedly into granulated sugar until it has a good "frosted" rim. Shake a jigger of Amaretto with the juice of 1/2 a lemon. Strain into glass and add ice. Garnish with a Marachino Cherry.
This is called the 501 Blue.  Blue Curacao,  Blueberry schnapps,  Vodka,  Sour mix,  7-Up. Mix equal amounts into a glass with ice.

This is called the Gideon's Green Dinosaur. 1/2 oz of Dark rum, 1/2 oz of Vodka, 1/2 oz of Triple sec, 1/2 oz of Tequila, 1/2 oz of Melon liqueur, Fill with of Mountain Dew. Add all ingredients in collins glass with ice and stir.
This is called the Big Red. 1/2 oz of Irish cream, 1/2 oz of Goldschlager. Pour ingredients into 1 ounce shot glass
This is called the Black and Brown. 1/2 of Guinness stout, 1/2 of Root beer. CAREFULLY to avoid explosive head formation: Pour Beer glass half full of favorite rootbeer and top off with Guinness.

This is called the Orangeade. 5 cl of Lemon juice, 15 cl of Orange juice, 2-3 cl of Sugar syrup,  Soda water. Place some ice cubes in a large tumbler or highball glass, add lemon juice, orange juice, sugar syrup, and stir well. Top up with cold soda water, serve with a drinking straw.

This is called the Orange Scented Hot Chocolate. 2 cups of Milk, 4 oz chopped bittersweet or semi-sweet of Chocolate, 3 2-inch strips of Orange peel, 1/2 tsp instant of Espresso, 1/8 tsp ground of Nutmeg. Combine all ingredients in heavy medium saucepan. Stir over low heat until chocolate melts. Increase heat and bring just to a boil, stirring often. Remove from heat and whisk untily frothy. Return to heat and bring to boil again. Remove from heat, whisk until frothy. Repeat heating and whisking once again. Discard orange peel. (Can be prepared 2 hours ahead. Let stand at room temperature. Before serving, bring just to boil, remove from heat and whisk until frothy.) Pour hot chocolate into coffee mugs. Makes 2 servings.

This is called the Berry Deadly. 2 pint of Everclear, 1 bottle Boone Strawberry Hill of Wine, 1/2 gal of Orange juice, 1 gal Tropical Berry of Kool-Aid. Add all ingredients to large bowl. Stir gently. Serve chilled.

This is called the Nuked Hot Chocolate. 2 tsp of Cocoa powder, 1 tsp of Sugar, 1/2 tsp of Vanilla extract, 12 oz of Milk. Mix with a bit of milk (1 oz or so) in coffee mug. Nuke mug for about 30-50 seconds. Stir until the heated cocoa dissolves. Fill mug with milk. Nuke for 1-2 minutes, depending on wattage and preferences as to burnt mouth parts.

This is called the Bermuda Highball. 3/4 oz of Brandy, 3/4 oz of Gin, 3/4 oz of Dry Vermouth,  Carbonated water,  Lemon peel. Pour brandy, gin, and dry vermouth into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the twist of lemon and serve. (Ginger ale may be substituted for carbonated water, if preferred.)
This is called the Negroni. 1 oz of Gin, 1 oz of Campari, 1 oz of Sweet Vermouth. Stir into glass over ice, garnish and serve.
This is called the Mudslinger. 750 ml of Southern Comfort, 1 L of Orange juice, 750 ml of Pepsi Cola. Add all contents to a large jug or punch bowl. Stir well!
This is called the Banana Cantaloupe Smoothie. Juice of 1/2 of Cantaloupe, 1 of Banana. Juice cantaloupe, pour juice into blender, add banana, and liquify.

This is called the Mocha-Berry. 6 oz of Coffee, 2 oz of Chambord raspberry liqueur, 2 tblsp of Cocoa powder,  Whipped cream. pour 6 oz. of coffee in a mug or Irish coffee cup. add coca mix and chambord, mix well and top off with whipped cream.

This is called the Microwave Hot Cocoa. 5 tblsp of Sugar, 3 tblsp of Cocoa powder, 1 dash of Salt, 3 tblsp hot of Water, 2 cups of Milk, 1/4 tsp of Vanilla extract. Combine sugar, cocoa, salt and hot water in 1-quart micro-proof measuring cup (or coffee mug). Microwave at HIGH (100%) for 1 to 1 1/2 minutes or until boiling. Add milk, sitr and microwave an additonal 1 1/2 to 2 minutes or until hot. Stir in vanilla, blend well.

This is called the Artillery Punch. 1 quart black of Tea, 1 quart of Rye whiskey, 1 fifth of Red wine, 1 pint Jamaican of Rum, 1/2 pint of Brandy, 1 1/2 oz of Benedictine, 1 pint of Orange juice, 1/2 pint of Lemon juice. Combine all the ingredients in a large punch bowl with a block of ice. If found too dry, sugar syrup may be added. Decorate with twists of lemon peel.

This is called the Arctic Fish. 1/3 part of Vodka, 1/3 part of Grape soda, 1/3 part of Orange juice, lots of Ice, 1 dash of Candy. Fill glass with ice and fish, add vodka, grape soda and orange juice. DO NOT STIR!!!!! Serve well chilled.

This is called the Apricot punch. 1 qt of Apricot brandy, 4 fifth of Champagne, 1 fifth of Vodka, 4 L of 7-Up, 1/2 gal of Orange juice. Pour all ingrediants into a large punch bowl. Add ice and 4 oranges that are peeled and divided.
This is called the Lone Tree Cocktail. 3/4 oz of Sweet Vermouth, 1 1/2 oz of Gin. Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Apple Cider Punch #1. 4 qt of Apple cider, 1 cup of Brown sugar, 6 oz frozen of Lemonade, 6 oz frozen of Orange juice, 6 whole of Cloves, 6 whole of Allspice, 1 tsp ground of Nutmeg, 3 sticks of Cinnamon. If you use the whole all spice and cloves, tie them in cheesecloth. Heat the mixture. Stir occasionally. If you want an alcoholic drink, rum would be nice.
This is called the Apple Berry Smoothie. 1 cup of Berries, 2 of Apple. Throw everything into a blender and liquify.
This is called the Angel Face. 1/2 oz of Apricot brandy, 1/2 oz of Apple brandy, 1 oz of Gin. Shake all ingredients with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass.

This is called the Amaretto Tea. 6 oz hot of Tea, 2 oz of Amaretto, Chilled of Whipped cream. Pour hot tea into a pousse-cafe glass, using a spoon in glass to prevent cracking. Add amaretto, but do not stir. Top with chilled whipped cream and serve.
This is called the Moranguito. 2/5 of Absinthe, 2/5 of Tequila, 1/5 of Grenadine. first you put rhe absinthe, then put tequila, then put the Granadine syrup.
This is called the Mother's Milk. 1 oz of Goldschlager, 1 oz of Butterscotch schnapps, 1 oz of Milk. Shake over ice, strain. Serves two.
This is called the Monkey Gland. 2 oz of Gin, 1 tsp of Benedictine, 1/2 oz of Orange juice, 1 tsp of Grenadine. Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
This is called the B-53. 1/3 shot of Kahlua, 1/3 shot of Sambuca, 1/3 shot of Grand Marnier. Layer the Kahlua, Sambucca and Grand Marnier into a shot glas in that order. Better than B-52
This is called the Autodafé. 4 cl of Vodka, 1 dash of Lime juice,  Soda water. Mix and fill up with soda water. Drunk by finns on a sunny day any time of the year and day.
This is called the Artillery. 1 1/2 tsp of Sweet Vermouth, 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 2 dashes of Bitters. Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
This is called the Arizona Antifreeze. 1/3 oz of Vodka, 1/3 oz of Midori melon liqueur, 1/3 oz of Sweet and sour. Pour all ingredients into shot glass and slam !!!!

This is called the Margarita. 1 1/2 oz of Tequila, 1/2 oz of Triple sec, 1 oz of Lime juice, None of Salt. Rub the rim of the glass with the lime slice to make the salt stick to it. Take care to moisten only the outer rim and sprinkle the salt on it. The salt should present to the lips of the imbiber and never mix into the cocktail. Shake the other ingredients with ice, then carefully pour into the glass.
This is called the Arise My Love. Chilled of Champagne, 1 tsp of Green Creme de Menthe. Put creme de menthe into a champagne flute. Fill with chilled champagne and serve.

This is called the Lunch Box. 3/4 bottle of Beer, 1 shot of Amaretto, 1 oz of Orange juice. Fill a pint glass almost full with beer. Then fill the rest with orange juice (careful not to fill it to the top). Then take the shot of Amaretto and drop it in.

This is called the Loch Lomond. 2 oz of Scotch, 1/2 oz of Drambuie, 1/2 oz of Dry Vermouth, 1 twist of of Lemon peel. In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, Drambuie, and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.

This is called the Limona Corona. 1 bottle of Corona, 1 oz of Bacardi Limon. Open the Corona. Fill the empty space in the neck in the bottle with the rum. The bottle should be filled to the top. Plug the bottle with your thumb or the palm of your hand. Turn the bottle upside-down so the rum and beer mix. Turn the bottle rightside-up, unplug, and drink.

This is called the Limeade. Juice of 1 of Lime, 1 tblsp of Sugar,  (seltzer water) Soda water,  of Lime peel. In a large glass, put the lime juice and sugar, and stir well. Add cold seltzer water to fill. Put the lime peels in the glass. Drink. Repeat until limes or soda run out.

This is called the Angelica Liqueur. 3 tblsp chopped of Angelica root, 1 tblsp chopped of Almond, 1 cracked of Allspice, 1 one-inch of Cinnamon, 3-6 crushed of Anise, 1/8 tsp powdered of Coriander, 1 tblsp fresh chopped of Marjoram leaves, 1.5 cup of Vodka, 1/2 cup granulated of Sugar. Combine all herbs, nuts and spices with vodka in a 1 quart or larger aging container. Cap tightly and shake daily for 2 weeks. Strain through a fine muslin cloth or coffee filter, discarding solids. Clean out aging container. Place liquid back in container. Place sugar and water in saucepan and stir to combine over medium heat. When sugar is completely dissolved, set aside and let cool. When cool combine with food coloring and add to liqueur liquid. Cap and allow to age and mellow in a cool, dark place for one month.
This is called the Lassi Khara. 1 cup of Yoghurt, 2 cups cold of Water, 1 tsp of Salt, 1 pinch of Asafoetida. Blend (frappe) in blender until frothy. Add torn curry leaves and serve cold.

This is called the Americano. 1 oz of Campari, 1 oz red of Sweet Vermouth, Twist of of Lemon peel, Twist of of Orange peel. Pour the Campari and vermouth over ice into glass, add a splash of soda water and garnish with half orange slice.

This is called the Kurant Tea. 4 cl of Absolut Kurant, Turkish apple of Tea,  (if needed) Sugar. Pour Absolut Kurant into a comfortably big tea-cup. Add the not too hot(!) apple tea and, if you like, some sugar. Enjoy!
This is called the Kiwi Papaya Smoothie. 3 of Kiwi, 1/2 of Papaya. Throw everything into a blender and liquify.
This is called the Amaretto And Cream. 1 1/2 oz of Amaretto, 1 1/2 oz of Light cream. Shake well with cracked ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.
This is called the Almeria. 2 oz of Dark rum, 1 oz of Kahlua, 1 of Egg white. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
This is called the Amaretto Stone Sour. 1 part of Amaretto, 1 part of Sour mix, 1 part of Orange juice. Shake and Serve over ice

This is called the Amaretto Shake. 2 scoops of Chocolate ice-cream, 2 oz of Brandy, 2 oz of Amaretto. Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend at high speed until smooth. Serve in chilled glass garnished with bittersweet chocolate shavings.

This is called the Kentucky Colonel. 3 oz of Bourbon, 1/2 oz of Benedictine, 1 twist of of Lemon peel. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes combine the courbon and Benedictine. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.
This is called the Kir. 1 part of Creme de Cassis, 5 parts of Champagne. Add the crème de cassis to the bottom of the glass, then top up with wine.

This is called the Karsk. 1 part of Coffee, 2 parts of Grain alcohol. Put a copper coin in a coffe-cup and fill up with coffee until you no longer see the coin, then add alcohol until you see the coin. Norwegian speciality.
This is called the Allies Cocktail. 1 oz of Dry Vermouth, 1 oz of Gin, 1/2 tsp of Kummel. Stir all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Jitterbug. 2 jiggers of Gin, 1 jigger of Vodka, 3 dashes of Grenadine, 1 shot of Lime juice, Around rim put 1 pinch of Sugar, 3 dashes of Sugar syrup, Fill to top with of Soda water. Wet glass, dip rim in sugar. Then add Ice. Then add everything else. It's that simple!

This is called the Jam Donut. 2/3 oz of Baileys irish cream, 1/3 oz of Chambord raspberry liqueur, 1 tsp of Sugar syrup, 2 pinches of Sugar. Coat the rim of a shot glass with sugar using sugar syrup to stick. Add the Chambord raspberry liqueur to the shot glass, and carefully layer the Baileys Irish Cream on top. Serve.

This is called the Irish Cream. 1 cup of Scotch, 1 1/4 cup of Half-and-half, 1 can sweetened of Condensed milk, 3 drops of Coconut syrup, 1 tblsp of Chocolate syrup. Mix scotch and milk. Add half-and-half. Add rest.

This is called the Affair. 2 oz of Strawberry schnapps, 2 oz of Orange juice, 2 oz of Cranberry juice,  Club soda. Pour schnapps, orange juice, and cranberry juice over ice in a highball glass. Top with club soda and serve.

This is called the Long vodka. 5 cl of Vodka, 1/2 of Lime, 4 dashes of Angostura bitters, 1 dl Schweppes of Tonic water, 4 of Ice. Shake a tall glass with ice cubes and Angostura, coating the inside of the glass. Por the vodka onto this, add 1 slice of lime and squeeze juice out of remainder, mix with tonic, stir and voila you have a Long Vodka
This is called the Apple Grande. 3 oz of Tequila, 12 oz of Apple cider. Chill both ingredients!! Mix in a tumbler and enjoy!
This is called the Kool First Aid. 2 oz light of 151 proof rum, 1/2 tsp Tropical of Kool-Aid. Add Kool Aid to a double shot glass, and top with rum. Slam and shoot.

This is called the Kool-Aid Shot. 1 shot of Vodka, 1 shot of Amaretto, 1 shot of Sloe gin, 1 shot of Triple sec,  Cranberry juice. Pour into a large glass with ice and stir. Add a little cranberry juice to taste.
This is called the Amaretto Stinger. 1 1/2 oz of Amaretto, 3/4 oz of White Creme de Menthe. Shake ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
This is called the Amaretto Sour. 1 1/2 oz of Amaretto, 3 oz of Sour mix. Shake and strain. Garnish with a cherry and an orange slice.
This is called the Kiss me Quick. 4 cl of Cranberry vodka, 2 cl of Apfelkorn, 7 cl of Schweppes Russchian, 8 cl of Apple juice,  cubes Ice. mix in the glass

This is called the Amaretto Liqueur. 1 cup of Sugar, 3/4 cup of Water, 2 of Apricot, 1 tblsp of Almond flavoring, 1/2 cup pure of Grain alcohol, 1/2 cup of Water, 1 cup of Brandy, 3 drops yellow of Food coloring, 6 drops red of Food coloring. Combine sugar and 3/4 cup water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer until all sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and cool. In an aging container, combine apricot halves, almond extract, grain alcohol with 1/2 cup water, and brandy. Stir in cooled sugar syrup mixture. Cap and let age for 2 days. Remove apricot halves. (Save apricot halves, can be used for cooking). Add food coloring and glycerine. Stir, recap and continue aging for 1 to 2 months. Re-bottle as desired. Liqueur is ready to serve but will continue to improve with additional aging.

This is called the Aloha Fruit punch. 3/4 cup of Water, 2 tsp of Ginger, 2 cups of Guava juice, 1 1/2 tblsp of Lemon juice, 1 1/2 cup of Pineapple, 1 cup of Sugar, 3-4 cups of Pineapple juice. Add 1/4 cup water to ginger root. Boil 3 minutes. Strain. Add the liquid to the guava, lemon and pineapple juices. Make a syrup of sugar and remaining water. Cool. Combine with juices and pineapple. Chill throroughly.

This is called the John Collins. 2 oz of Bourbon, 1 oz of Lemon juice, 1 tsp superfine of Sugar, 3 oz of Club soda, 1 of Maraschino cherry, 1 of Orange. Pour all ingredients directly into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Garnish. Add a dash of Angostura bitters.

This is called the Balmoral. 1 1/2 oz of Scotch, 1/2 oz of Sweet Vermouth, 1/2 oz of Dry Vermouth, 2 dashes of Bitters. In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
This is called the Moscow Mule. 2 oz of Vodka, 2 oz of Lime juice, 8 oz of Ginger ale. Combine vodka and ginger beer in a highball glass filled with ice. Add lime juice. Stir gently. Garnish.

This is called the Aztec Punch. 1 can of Lemonade, 5 oz of Vodka, 7 oz of Rum, About 1 bottle of Ginger ale. Mix all ingredients in a pitcher. Mix thoroughly and pour into whatever is available, the bigger the better! This drink packs a big punch, so don't over do it.

This is called the Army special. 30 ml of Vodka, 30 ml of Gin, 45 ml of Lime juice cordial, 1/2 glass crushed of Ice. Pour Vodka, Gin and lime cordial into glass, and top up with crushed ice. Wait for ice to melt slightly and sip without a straw.

This is called the Martinez Cocktail. 1 oz of Gin, 1 oz of Dry Vermouth, 1/4 tsp of Triple sec, 1 dash of Orange bitters, 1 of Cherry. Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.

This is called the Manhattan. 3/4 oz of Sweet Vermouth, 2 1/2 oz Blended of Bourbon, dash of Angostura bitters, 2 or 3 of Ice, 1 of Maraschino cherry, 1 twist of of Orange peel. Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served up.

This is called the Mai Tai. 1 oz of Light rum, 1/2 oz of Orgeat syrup, 1/2 oz of Triple sec, 1 1/2 oz of Sweet and sour, 1 of Cherry. Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain into glass. Garnish and serve with straw.
This is called the Applejack. 1 oz of Jack Daniels, 1/2 oz of Midori melon liqueur, 2 oz of Sour mix. Add all ingredients into mixing glass, chill and strain into cocktail glass
This is called the Apple Pie with A Crust. 3 parts of Apple juice, 1 part of Malibu rum, 3 dashes of Cinnamon. Just mix the two liquids and sprinkle in the cinnamon. Serve either cold or heated.

This is called the Apple Karate. 2 cups of Apple juice, 1 large of Carrot. Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
This is called the Lemon Drop. 1 1/2 shot of Absolut Vodka, 1 1/2 shot of Cointreau, Juice of 1 wedge of Lemon. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass rimmed with sugar.

This is called the Amaretto Sunset. 1/2 jigger of Triple sec, 3 shots of Amaretto, 1/2 cup of Cider, Add 1/2 cup of Ice. Shake ingredients in bartender's mixer quickly, just 5 shakes. Strain out ice, serve in glass immediately with a slice of orange.
This is called the Amaretto Rose. 1 1/2 oz of Amaretto, 1/2 oz of Lime juice,  Club soda. Pour amaretto and lime juice over ice in a collins glass. Fill with club soda and serve.
This is called the Kioki Coffee. 1 oz of Kahlua, 1/2 oz of Brandy,  Coffee. Stir. Add whipped cream to the top.
This is called the Kill the cold Smoothie. 1 inch of Ginger, 1/4 of Lemon, 1 cup hot of Water. Juice ginger and lemon and add it to hot water. You may add cardomom.
This is called the Kamikaze. 1 oz of Vodka, 1 oz of Triple sec, 1 oz of Lime juice. Shake all ingredients together with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve.
This is called the Alice in Wonderland. 1 shot of Amaretto, 1 shot of Grand Marnier, 1 shot of Southern Comfort. Just mix the three ingredients one to one to one

This is called the Alexander. 1/2 oz of Gin, 1/2 oz white of Creme de Cacao, 2 oz of Light cream, None of Nutmeg. Shake all ingredients with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
This is called the Jackhammer. 1 oz of Jack Daniels, 1 oz of Amaretto. Serve over ice- Warning,Deadly!
This is called the Afterglow. 1 part of Grenadine, 4 parts of Orange juice, 4 parts of Pineapple juice. Mix. Serve over ice.

This is called the Jewel Of The Nile. 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 1/2 oz of Green Chartreuse, 1/2 oz of Yellow Chartreuse. In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
This is called the Jelly Bean. 1 oz of Blackberry brandy, 1 oz of Anis. mix equal parts in pony glass-tastes just like a jelly bean!
This is called the Algonquin. 1 1/2 oz of Blended whiskey, 1 oz of Dry Vermouth, 1 oz of Pineapple juice. Combine and shake all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.
This is called the Alfie Cocktail. 1 1/2 oz of Lemon vodka, 1 dash of Triple sec, 1 tblsp of Pineapple juice. Combine and shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Japanese Fizz. 1 1/2 oz of Blended whiskey, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1 tblsp of Port, 1 of Egg white,  Carbonated water. Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.

This is called the Irish Spring. 1 oz of Irish whiskey, 1/2 oz of Peach brandy, 1 oz of Orange juice, 1 oz of Sweet and sour, 1 slice of Orange, 1 of Cherry. Pour all ingredients (except orange slice and cherry) into a collins glass over ice cubes. Garnish with the slice of orange, add the cherry on top, and serve.

This is called the Affinity. 1 1/2 oz of Scotch, 1 oz of Sweet Vermouth, 1 oz of Dry Vermouth, 2 dashes of Orange bitters. In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

This is called the Alabama Slammer. 1 oz of Southern Comfort, 1 oz of Amaretto, 1/2 oz of Sloe gin, 1 dash of Lemon juice. Pour all ingredients (except for lemon juice) over ice in a highball glass. Stir, add a dash of lemon juice, and serve.
This is called the Jack Rose Cocktail. 1 1/2 oz of Apple brandy, 1 tsp of Grenadine, Juice of 1/2 of Lime. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Jamaican Coffee. 1/6 glass of Rum, 1/6 glass strong black of Coffee, 1/2 glass cold of Water,  Whipped cream. Stir the rum, coffee and water together. Top with the whipped cream. Sprinkle with a pinch of well ground coffee and drink with a straw.

This is called the Irish Coffee. 1 1/2 oz of Irish whiskey, 8 oz of Coffee, 1 tsp of Sugar, 1 tblsp of Whipped cream. Heat the coffee, whiskey and sugar; do not boil. Pour into glass and top with cream; serve hot.
This is called the Adonis Cocktail. 3/4 oz of Sweet Vermouth, 1 1/2 oz dry of Sherry, 1 dash of Orange bitters. Stir all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Ipamena. ½ of Lime, 2 tsp of Brown sugar, 4 cl of Passion fruit juice, top up with of Ginger ale, fill of Ice. Cut half a lime into pieces, place in a shaker, add the sugar and crush. Measure the passion fruit juice, add it to the shaker and fill up with ice cubes. Close the shaker and shake vigorously. Pour the liquid into a glass, top up with ginger ale, stir with a teaspoon and then garnish the rim of the glass with a slice of lime

This is called the Imperial Fizz. 1/2 oz of Light rum, 1 1/2 oz of Blended whiskey, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar,  Carbonated water. Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
This is called the Imperial Cocktail. 4 cl of Lime juice, 2 cl of Gin, 4 cl of Aperol. Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

This is called the Hot Chocolate to Die for. 12 oz fine of Chocolate, 1 tsp of Butter, 1/2 tsp of Vanilla extract, 1 cup of Half-and-half, mini of Marshmallows. Melt the chocolate, butter and vanilla in a double boiler. When just smooth stir in the cream.
This is called the Adam & Eve. 1 shot of Gin, 1 shot of Cognac, 1 shot of Creme de Cassis, 1/8 shot of Fresh Lemon Juice. Shake together all the ingredients and strain into a cold glass.

This is called the Addison Special. 1 shot of Vodka, 1 tblsp of Grenadine, Fill with of Orange juice. Combine ingredients in the order listed into a shaker. Fill half full with ice and shake well. Strain into glass with ice and garnish with a cherry and orange wedge.

This is called the Adam Sunrise. 1/2 of Vodka, 1/2 can of Lemonade, 1/2 of Water, 10 tsp of Sugar. Fill blender up with ice. Fill half with Bartons Vodka. Put 10 tsp of sugar, add 1/2 can lemonade concentrate, fill to top with water. Blend for 60 seconds.
This is called the Adam. 2 oz of Dark rum, 1 oz of Lemon juice, 1 tsp of Grenadine. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

This is called the Highland Fling Cocktail. 1 1/2 oz of Scotch, 3/4 oz of Sweet Vermouth, 2 dashes of Orange bitters, 1 of Olive. Stir all ingredients (except olive) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the olive and serve.

This is called the Harvey Wallbanger. 1 oz of Vodka, 1/2 oz of Galliano, 4 oz of Orange juice. Stir the vodka and orange juice with ice in the glass, then float the Galliano on top. Garnish and serve.

This is called the After Five.  Peppermint schnapps,  Kahlua,  Bailey's irish cream. 1. Pour Kahlua into shot glass to about 1/2 full. 2. Using a spoon(inverted), slowly pour in the Peppermint Schnapps until glass is about 3/4 full. Done correctly, the Schnapps will flow under the Kahlua for a clear layer. 3. Again using a spoon, but this time right side up, slowly top off the glass with a layer of Bailey's. Be careful to place the spoon right at the top of the Kahlua layer and to raise it as the glass fills up. Done correctly, this will provide a layer of Bailey's floating over the Kahlua. 4. Toss it down all at once for something like a Peppermint Pattie, WITH A BANG!!! NOTE: Best if all ingredients are chilled

This is called the Irish Curdling Cow. 3/4 oz of Bailey's irish cream, 3/4 oz of Bourbon, 3/4 oz of Vodka, 2-3 oz of Orange juice. Pour Irish Cream, Vodka, and Bourbon in a glass. Add some ice and mix in the orange juice.

This is called the After Dinner Cocktail. 1 oz of Apricot brandy, 1 oz of Triple sec, Juice of 1 of Lime, 1 of Lime. Shake all ingredients (except lime wedge) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the wedge of lime and serve.
This is called the Addison. 1 1/2 shot of Gin, 1 1/2 shot of Vermouth. Shake together all the ingredients and strain into a cold glass.

This is called the Iced Coffee. 1/4 cup instant of Coffee, 1/4 cup of Sugar, 1/4 cup hot of Water, 4 cups cold of Milk. Mix together until coffee and sugar is dissolved. Add milk. Shake well. Using a blender or milk shake maker produces a very foamy drink. Serve in coffee mug.
This is called the Ice Pick #1. 1 1/2 oz of Vodka, 6 oz of Iced tea,  to taste Lemon juice. Put Vodka in glass fill with iced tea. Stir in lemon to taste.

This is called the Ace. 2 shots of Gin, 1/2 shot of Grenadine, 1/2 shot of Heavy cream, 1/2 shot of Milk, 1/2 Fresh of Egg White. Shake all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker and ice then strain in a cold glass.

This is called the Holloween Punch.  Grape juice, , orange Carbonated soft drink,  of Sherbet,  of Sherbet. Take a bunch of grape juice and a bunch of fizzy stuff (club soda, ginger ale, lemonlime, whatever). Mix them in a punch bowl. Take orange sherbet and lime sherbet. Scoop out scoops and float them in the punch, let them melt a little so that a nasty film spreads all over the top of the punch but there are still "bubbles" in it in the form of sherbet scoops. Looks horrible, tastes just fine.

This is called the Herbal flame. 5 shots of Hot Damn, very sweet of Tea. Pour Hot Damn 100 in bottom of a jar or regular glass. Fill the rest of the glass with sweet tea. Stir with spoon, straw, or better yet a cinnamon stick and leave it in.

This is called the Absolutely Fabulous. 1 shot of Vodka, 2 shots of Cranberry Juice, Top up with of Champagne. Mix the Vodka and Cranberry juice together in a shaker and strain into a glass. Top up with Champagne.

This is called the Adios Amigos Cocktail. 1 shot of Rum, 1/2 shot of Dry Vermouth, 1/2 shot of Cognac, 1/2 shot of Gin, 1/4 shot of Fresh Lime Juice, 1/4 shot of Sugar Syrup, 1/2 shot of Water. Shake together all the ingredients and strain into a cold glass.
This is called the Iced Coffee Fillip. 2 tsp of Kahlua, Strong cold of Coffee. Mix together in a coffee mug and chill before serving.
This is called the Hot Creamy Bush. 1 shot of Irish whiskey, 3/4 shot of Bailey's irish cream, 6 oz hot of Coffee. Combine all ingredients in glass

This is called the Jack's Vanilla Coke. 4-5 of Ice, 2 oz of Tennessee whiskey, 1 tsp of Vanilla extract, 10-12 oz of Coca-Cola. After pouring in your ingredients, and adding 3-5 ice cubes, according to taste. Stir the drink with a stirrer to get the Vanilla off the bottom.

This is called the After sex. 2 cl of Vodka, 1 cl of Creme de Banane,  Orange juice. Pour the vodka and creme over some ice cubes in a tall glass and fill up with juice. to make it beuty full make the top of the glass with a grenadine and sugar
This is called the After Supper Cocktail. 1 oz of Triple sec, 1 oz of Apricot brandy, 1/2 tsp of Lemon juice. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

This is called the Addington. 2 shots of Sweet Vermouth, 1 shot of Dry Vermouth, Top up with Soda Water. Mix both the vermouth's in a shaker and strain into a cold glass. Top up with a squirt of Soda Water.

This is called the Horse's Neck. 1 long strip of Lemon peel, 2 oz of Brandy, 5 oz of Ginger ale, 2 dashes of Bitters. Pour brandy and ginger ale directly into highball glass with ice cubes. Stir gently. Garnish with lemon zest. If desired, add dashes of Angostura Bitter.

This is called the Acapulco. 1 1/2 oz of Light rum, 1 1/2 tsp of Triple sec, 1 tblsp of Lime juice, 1 tsp of Sugar, 1 of Egg white, 1 of Mint. Combine and shake all ingredients (except mint) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the sprig of mint and serve.

This is called the Absolutly Screwed Up. 1 shot of Absolut Citron, 1 shot of Orange juice, 1 shot of Triple sec, Fill to top of Ginger ale. Shake it up it tasts better that way, but you can stir it if you want. 6 of those and you will be wasted for the rest of the night.
This is called the H.D.. 4 cl of Whisky, 8 cl of Bailey's irish cream,  Coffee. Mix the whisky and Baileys Cream in a beer-glass (at least 50 cl). Fill the rest of the glass with coffee.

This is called the Absolut Stress #2. 1 1/2 oz of Absolut Vodka, 1/2 oz of Peach schnapps, 1/2 oz of Coconut liqueur, 1 1/2 oz of Cranberry juice, 1 1/2 oz of Pineapple juice. Mix well. Garnish with Orange and Cherry. Enjoy
This is called the Green Goblin. 1/2 pint hard of Cider, 1/2 pint of Lager, 1 shot of Blue Curacao. Cider First, Lager then Curacao

This is called the Absolut Sex. 3/4 oz of Absolut Kurant, 3/4 oz of Midori melon liqueur, 1 oz of Cranberry juice, 1 splash of Sprite. Shake Absolut Kurant, Midori, and Cranberry juice in shaker with ice: Strain into rocks glass: Splash of seven on top.Absolut Sex.

This is called the Happy Skipper. 1 1/2 cl of Spiced rum,  Ginger ale,  Lime,  Ice. Pour Captain Morgan's Spiced Rum over ice, fill glass to top with Ginger Ale. Garnish with lime. Tastes like a cream soda. Named for the Gilligan's Island reference ("The Captain" *in* "Ginger" is a Happy Skipper!)
This is called the Abilene. 1 1/2 oz of Dark rum, 2 oz of Peach nectar, 3 oz of Orange juice. Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
This is called the Grim Reaper. 1 oz of Kahlua, 1 oz Bacardi of 151 proof rum, 1 dash of Grenadine. Mix Kahlua and 151 in glass. Quickly add ice and pour grenadine over ice to give ice red tint.
This is called the A.D.M. (After Dinner Mint). 1/2 oz of White Creme de Menthe, 3/4 oz of Southern Comfort, 1/2 oz of Vodka, Fill with of Hot chocolate. shake vigorously

This is called the Gin Toddy. 2 oz of Gin, 2 tsp of Water, 1/2 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1 twist of of Lemon peel. Mix powdered sugar and water in an old-fashioned glass. Add gin and one ice cube. Stir, add the twist of lemon peel, and serve.
This is called the Golden dream. 2 parts of Galliano, 2 parts of Triple Sec, 2 parts of orange juice, 1 part of Cream. Shake with cracked ice. Strain into glass and serve.

This is called the Abbey Cocktail. 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 1 dash of Orange bitters, Juice of 1/4 of Orange, 1 of Cherry. Shake all ingredients (except for the cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.

This is called the Gin Sling. 2 oz of Gin, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar, 1 tsp of Water, Twist of of Orange peel. Dissolve powdered sugar in mixture of water and juice of lemon. Add gin. Pour into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes and stir. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.
This is called the 252. 1/2 shot Bacardi of 151 proof rum, 1/2 shot of Wild Turkey. Add both ingredients to shot glass, shoot, and get drunk quick

This is called the Gin Rickey. 2 oz of Gin, 1 tsp of Grenadine, Juice of 1/2 of lemon, Top up with of Soda Water, Garnish of Lime. Half-fill a tall glass with ice. Mix the gin and Grenadine together and pour over the ice. Add the lime or lemon juice and top off with soda water. Decorate the glass with lime and/or lemon slices.

This is called the Gentleman's Club. 1 1/2 oz of Gin, 1 oz of Brandy, 1 oz of Sweet Vermouth, 1 oz of Club soda. In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well.
This is called the 69 Special. 2 oz dry of Gin, 4 oz of 7-Up, 0.75 oz of Lemon juice. Pour 2 oz. gin. Add 4 oz. 7-up. Add Lemon Juice for flavor. If you are weak, top up glass with more 7-Up.

This is called the 9 1/2 Weeks. 2 oz of Absolut Citron, 1/2 oz of Orange Curacao, 1 splash of Strawberry liqueur, 1 oz of Orange juice. Combine all ingredients in glass mixer. Chill and strain into Cocktail glass. Garnish with sliced strawberry.

This is called the A Night In Old Mandalay. 1 oz of Light rum, 1 oz of Añejo rum, 1 oz of Orange juice, 1/2 oz of Lemon juice, 3 oz of Ginger ale, 1 twist of of Lemon peel. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the light rum, añejo rum, orange juice, and lemon juice. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Top with the ginger ale. Garnish with the lemon twist.

This is called the Gin Fizz. 2 oz of Gin, Juice of 1/2 of Lemon, 1 tsp of Powdered sugar, None of Carbonated water. Shake all ingredients with ice cubes, except soda water. Pour into glass. Top with soda water.

This is called the GG. 2 1/2 shots of Galliano,  Ginger ale,  of Ice. Pour the Galliano liqueur over ice. Fill the remainder of the glass with ginger ale and thats all there is to it. You now have a your very own GG.
This is called the 3 Wise Men. 1/3 oz of Jack Daniels, 1/3 oz of Johnnie Walker, 1/3 oz of Jim Beam. put them them in a glass... and slam it to tha head.
This is called the Fruit Shake. 1 cup fruit of Yoghurt, 1 of Banana, 4 oz frozen of Orange juice, 1/2 piece textural of Fruit, 6 of Ice. Blend til smooth.

This is called the 151 Florida Bushwacker. 1/2 oz of Malibu rum, 1/2 oz of Light rum, 1/2 oz Bacardi of 151 proof rum, 1 oz of Dark Creme de Cacao, 1 oz of Cointreau, 3 oz of Milk, 1 oz of Coconut liqueur, 1 cup of Vanilla ice-cream. Combine all ingredients. Blend until smooth. Garnish with chocolate shavings if desired.

This is called the 1-900-FUK-MEUP. 1/2 oz of Absolut Kurant, 1/4 oz of Grand Marnier, 1/4 oz of Chambord raspberry liqueur, 1/4 oz of Midori melon liqueur, 1/4 oz of Malibu rum, 1/4 oz of Amaretto, 1/2 oz of Cranberry juice, 1/4 oz of Pineapple juice. Shake ingredients in a mixing tin filled with ice cubes. Strain into a rocks glass.

This is called the Frisco Sour. 2 oz of Blended whiskey, 1/2 oz of Benedictine, Juice of 1/4 of Lemon, Juice of 1/2 of Lime, 1 slice of Lemon, 1 slice of Lime. Shake all ingredients (except slices of lemon and lime) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with the slices of lemon and lime and serve.
This is called the '57 Chevy with a White License Plate. 1 oz white of Creme de Cacao, 1 oz of Vodka. 1. Fill a rocks glass with ice 2.add white creme de cacao and vodka 3.stir
